title: Program Coordinator, Full Service Community Schools State Scale Up
description: Partners for Rural Impact’s (PRI)ultimate goal is for an America where all kids are successful, regardless of zip code, income, background, or ability.

raw.title: Program Coordinator, Full Service Community Schools State Scale Up
raw.excerpt: Partners for Rural Impact’s (PRI)ultimate goal is for an America where all kids are successful, regardless of zip code, income, background, or ability.
raw.description:
Partners for Rural Impact’s (PRI)ultimate goal is for an America where all kids are successful, regardless of zip code, income, background, or ability. At PRI, our focus is on ensuring that all children in rural places achieve success. Partners for Rural Impact was born out of our place-based partnership in Appalachia, where we’ve worked for 25 years to create student opportunity and success.

Position Summary

The Program Coordinator (PC) is a full-time, grant funded position that will report to the Program Manager of the Full-Service Community Schools team.  The PC will develop systems to effectively manage projects, records, and materials related to program activities, ensuring consistency in workflow and program administration best practices. The Program Coordinator operates with the goal in mind that All Rural Students Succeed.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each primary duty satisfactorily. The requirements of the position are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required, with regular and predictable attendance essential. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • Develop and monitor project timelines, due dates and milestones for events, including drafting contracts, initiating purchase requests, and creating registration sites; provide regular progress reports to teams to ensure work is compliant and progressing as expected 
  • Perform general clerical/administrative support, including correspondence, order office supplies, travel arrangements and arranging for the pickup, sorting and delivery of mail  
  • Manage communications/correspondence with internal and external partners via telephone, e-mail, and mail 
  • Coordination and administration of strategy applications and database services
  • Coordinate meeting logistics for training programs and special events; initiate bids and quotes for meeting space, meals, audio/visual equipment and program materials, and booking travel for participants and staff  
  • Manage synchronous and asynchronous technology needs for virtual and in-person learning engagements, providing technical assistance to participants and drafting training materials for each learning engagement 
  • Supports grant development activities to include researching proposed grant programs, creating files for potential grant applications, reviewing and editing grant narratives, and collaborating with grant services staff to obtain required submission documents 
  • Develop community and organizational profiles for partners, including both qualitative and quantitative data 
  • Oversee and maintain weekly schedules of staff on Outlook and coordinates with partners to determine engagement dates and times 
  • Meeting preparation and onsite meeting support activities: refreshments, agenda dissemination, provide prior meeting summaries and post-meeting summaries electronically to participants 
  • Manage project budgets, ensuring all expenditures are allowable and within scope of work; and contributes to budget projections 
  • Review purchase card reports, district reimbursement requests and travel requests prior approval; collaborate with Finance department to ensure expenses are allowable, reasonable and necessary to meet program goals & objectives
  • Prepare and track necessary contracts and agreements 
  • Serve on Partners for Rural Impact committees, as needed  

Position Location & Schedule

This position will be located primarily in the Perry, Breathitt or Knott Counties in KY with local, state, and sometimes national travel required. 

Normal business hours are Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. with in-office, hybrid and/or remote workpossible. Because of the nature of the responsibility to schools, partners, funders, and to the service region, individual offices or departments may have operating hours that extend beyond this period and may include evening and/or weekend hours.

Minimum Qualifications

Education required to ensure success in this position:

  • Associate’s degree or five to seven years of related experience.

Experience required to ensure success in this position:

  • Administrative experience within a professional office setting  
  • Experience working with data collection, meeting planning/coordination, event planning, budgetary monitoring, and scheduling of events and teams 
  • Minimum two years' experience in project management from initiation to completion 

Special skills, knowledge and abilities:

  • Demonstrated proficiency in all Microsoft Office applications and ability to operate and support multiple technology platforms used in virtual engagement and learning opportunities 
  • Knowledge of general business operations, human resources, or grants management/federal college access grant programs 
  • Exceptional written and oral presentation skills 
  • Demonstrated ability to multi-task and successfully manage several projects simultaneously 
  • Must maintain confidentiality and protect the private nature of files and correspondence 
  • Demonstrated experience in event planning and implementation 
  • Demonstrated ability to build relationships and work collaboratively with others 

License, certification, or registration necessary:

  • Valid driver’s license
  • Successfully complete pre-employment background check

Physical requirements:

  • Ability to work in a high-energy office
  • Ability to accurately communicate and exchange information with partners, stakeholders, and/or meeting participants
  • Ability to operate standard office equipment and computer software programs
  • Ability to operate motor vehicle
  • Ability to travel independently by car and plane to eastern Kentucky, statewide sites, and nationally

Environmental conditions:

  • Work in a fast-paced setting with frequent interruptions and shifting priorities
  • Periodic travel to meetings and events

Additional Company Information

PRI offers a wide array of benefit options, to meet the financial, educational, and health needs of you and your family.

  • Comprehensive insurance plans including medical, dental, vision, and prescription coverage.
  • Flexible spending accounts, plus an employee assistance program.
  • Life and long-term disability insurance and retirement plan.
  • Generous paid time off work options including vacation, sick leave, and annual holidays, in addition to paid parental leave.
  • Tuition assistance and professional development for employees.

Partners for Rural Impact is an Equal Opportunity Employer that recruits and hires qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, disability, or veteran status.

raw.title: Développeur(se) - Full Stack Java Angular - Services Financiers- Le Mans
raw.excerpt: Dans le cadre de notre développement auprès de nos clients grands comptes sur le bassin du Mans, nous recherchons un(e) Développeur(se) Full Stack Java Angular disposant d'une solide expérience sur ces technologies et souhaitant évoluer rapidement dans un contexte stimulant (outils, frameworks et versions de langages récentes, avec une volonté de se maintenir à jour).
raw.description:
Dans le cadre de notre développement auprès de nos clients grands comptes sur le bassin du Mans, nous recherchons un(e) Développeur(se) Full Stack Java Angular disposant d'une solide expérience sur ces technologies et souhaitant évoluer rapidement dans un contexte stimulant (outils, frameworks et versions de langages récentes, avec une volonté de se maintenir à jour).

Les premières missions s'effectueront aussi bien dans le domaine de l’assurance que des services publics. Nous sommes en proximité des activités de nos clients et dans un accompagnement au plus fin de leurs roadmaps applicatives.

Particularités du client :

  • Projets stratégiques pour des acteurs majeurs de l’assurance et du secteur public, avec un impact direct sur des millions d’usagers
  • Contexte réglementaire et forte visibilité des applications
  • Culture projet : approche Agile et collaboration étroite avec les équipes métiers

Votre rôle et vos missions :

Au sein d'une équipe Agile, vous intervenez sur tout le cycle de vie du projet :

  • Vous participez à la conception et aux spécifications techniques des applications
  • Vous intervenez sur le développement d'applications (backend, frontend, ou les deux)
  • Vous participez aux cérémonies agiles (grooming, sprint planning, daily meeting, rétros, démos)
  • Vous participez à la veille technologique et l’amélioration continue (refacto, code review)
  • Vous encadrez et accompagnez les juniors dans leur montée en compétences
  • Vous êtes force de proposition sur les choix techniques et sur les processus d'amélioration continue (qualité et harmonisation du code, DOR, DOD, gestion du code source, etc)

Environnement :

  • Architecture : microservices, API REST, SPA
  • Front-end : Angular 15, 16 et 18, librairies graphiques personnalisées, responsive design
  • Back-end : Java 8, 11, 17, Spring Boot 3.3.5, Spring Batch, Oracle hbase, PostgreSQL, Apache Camel
  • Cloud & DevOps : GitLab CI/CD, Jenkins, SonarQube, Nexus
  • Sécurité & conformité : OAuth2, OpenID Connect, IAM, RGPD
  • Tests & qualité : JUnit, Karma/Jasmine, automatisation des tests (Selenium)
  • Performance & observabilité : monitoring applicatif, logs centralisés, dashboards, dynatrace
  • Méthodologie : Scrum, Kanban, SAFe, cycle en V

Rejoindre Sopra Steria Le Mans c’est…

Faire partie d’une équipe solidaire et dynamique.

Être accompagné tant côté RH que côté opérationnel pour atteindre ses objectifs et évoluer au sein de l’entreprise.

Profitez d’un site agréable à deux pas de la gare.

Partager régulièrement des moments conviviaux organisés tout au long de l’année par une équipe d’animation.

Diplômé(e) d'une école d'Ingénieurs ou équivalent Universitaire, vous disposez d'une expérience minimale de 5 ans dans le développement.

Vous êtes reconnu(e) pour votre rigueur, votre pédagogie et votre capacité à transmettre vos connaissances et votre savoir-faire aux autres.

Dans le cadre de l'évolution de nos compétences et de celles de nos clients, vous pouvez être amenés à encadrer, tutorer ou faire grandir les collaborateurs et intervenants dans votre équipe.

Une expérience en termes de Tech Lead est un atout pour pouvoir aider à organiser les projets et les activités des autres développeurs.

Alors sans plus attendre, intégrez une entreprise où règne un esprit entrepreneurial fort et une atmosphère propice à votre évolution : participez à une transformation durable grâce à une véritable aventure humaine au sein d'un grand groupe international.

  • Un accord télétravail pour télétravailler jusqu’à 2 jours par semaine selon vos missions.
  • Un package avantages intéressant : une mutuelle, un CSE, des titres restaurants, un accord d’intéressement, des primes vacances et cooptation.
  • Des opportunités de carrières multiples : plus de 30 familles de métiers, autant de passerelles à imaginer ensemble.
  • Plusieurs centaines de formations accessibles en toute autonomie avec Sopra Steria Academy.
  • La possibilité de s'engager auprès de notre fondation ou de notre partenaire « Vendredi ».
  • L'opportunité de rejoindre le collectif Tech'Me UP (formations, conférences, veille, et bien plus encore…).

Employeur inclusif et engagé, notre société œuvre chaque jour pour lutter contre toute forme de discrimination et favoriser un environnement de travail respectueux. C’est pourquoi, attachés à la mixité et à la diversité, nous encourageons toutes les candidatures et tous les profils.

https://www.soprasteria.fr/nous-connaitre/nos-engagements

Sopra Steria, acteur majeur de la Tech en Europe, avec 51 000 collaborateurs dans près de 30 pays, est reconnu pour ses activités de conseil, de services et solutions numériques. Il aide ses clients à mener leur transformation digitale et à obtenir des bénéfices concrets et durables. Le Groupe apporte une réponse globale aux enjeux de compétitivité des grandes entreprises et organisations, en combinant une connaissance approfondie des secteurs d’activité et des technologies à une approche collaborative. Sopra Steria place l’humain au cœur de son action et s’engage auprès de ses clients à tirer le meilleur parti du numérique pour construire un avenir positif. En 2024, le Groupe a réalisé un chiffre d’affaires de 5,8 milliards d’euros.

The world is how we shape it*

title: logistics Representative
description: C. H.  Robinson is seeking a Logistics Representative to manage customer’s supply chain information and data within C.

raw.title: logistics Representative
raw.excerpt: C. H.  Robinson is seeking a Logistics Representative to manage customer’s supply chain information and data within C.
raw.description:
C.H. Robinson is seeking a Logistics Representative to manage customer’s supply chain information and data within C.H. Robinson’s Transportation Management System. In this key position, you will act as an extension of the customer’s staff to ensure that all information flows properly and efficiently to ensure all transportation arrangements are made.

At C.H. Robinson, we believe that in-person collaboration is key to driving innovation and achieving success. In this role, you will work on-site with your peers five days a week, fostering creativity and producing impactful results through face-to-face interactions. Experience the full benefits of teamwork and immediate collaboration in a vibrant and engaging workplace.

Responsibilities:

The duties and responsibilities of this position consists of, but are not limited to, the following:

  • Ensure Transportation arrangements are made for shipments by the following:
    • Monitoring customer load board and information flow in the Transportation Management System
    • Maintaining any team mailboxes
    • Performing relationship and knowledge-based exception management to any pre-defined processes
  • Document and organize existing standard operating processes
  • Learn multiple job functions within assigned team
  • Facilitate customer calls and updates, identify when an outgoing call is needed to offer proactive answers
  • Meet operational metrics
  • Conduct C.H.Robinson systems trainings to external C.H.Robinson customer representatives
  • Manage reconciliation of daily, weekly, monthly, and quarterly reports
  • Make fact-based suggestions on how customers can achieve their goals in utilizing C.H.Robinson by understanding C.H.Robinson’s value proposition
  • Act as a resource and support for peers when needed
  • Understand and utilize C.H.Robinson’s project-based delivery model to find process improvements and cost savings within area of responsibility and/or team
  • Other duties or responsibilities as assigned according to the team and/or country specific requirements

Required Qualifications:

Required:

  • High School Diploma and/or GED
  • Minimum 2 years of experience in Supply Chain, Transportation, and/or Logistics
  • Minimum 1 year of prior experience working with and troubleshooting information systems
  • Ability to work flexible schedule on occasion, including overtime hours when requested
  • Ability to travel up to 5% (domestic and/or international)
  • Site Specific: Fluent in English and the primary language of the applicable region

Preferred Qualifications:

Preferred:

  • Bachelor’s degree from accredited college or university
  • Excellent customer service skills
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite of programs
  • Ability to present to a variety of audiences
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to think critically, analyze data and solve problems quickly and accurately
  • Ability to work in a team oriented and fast-paced environment
  • Ability to prioritize and handle a variety of tasks
  • Continuous improvement mindset
  • Ability to adapt to an ambiguous and changing environment
  • Ability to motivate and encourage change, able to get positive results in a very large, dispersed organization
  • Values a diverse and inclusive work environment

Equal Opportunity

C.H. Robinson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to a workplace and performance culture that reflects the strengths of our worldwide marketplace. We value unique experiences and diverse backgrounds of our people within our company, our business relationships, and our communities. We’re committed to providing an inclusive environment, free from harassment and discrimination, where all employees feel welcomed, valued and respected.

Benefits

• EPF contribution 15%

• Group Health Insurance

• Flexible Benefit (Dental treatment or Optical purchase)

• Birthday Leave

title: Fullstack Engineer
description: About the company GetBlock is a leading RPC node provider and Web3 infrastructure platform trusted by devs worldwide.

raw.title: Fullstack Engineer
raw.excerpt: About the company GetBlock is a leading RPC node provider and Web3 infrastructure platform trusted by devs worldwide.
raw.description:
About the company

GetBlock is a leading RPC node provider and Web3 infrastructure platform trusted by devs worldwide. Since 2019, we have empowered crypto innovators with instant and reliable access to 120+ blockchains through robust production-ready APIs.

Our team’s deep blockchain expertise and passion for innovation drive us to build the infrastructure layer for the next generation of blockchain applications. At GetBlock, we move fast, think creatively, and deliver high-impact products. Our culture blends technical excellence with entrepreneurial spirit, making us a dynamic force in the Web3 space.

About the role

We're looking for a Middle+ Fullstack Engineer to work across the entire stack - from customer-facing interfaces to backend services powering our platform. You'll split your time roughly 50/50 between frontend and backend work, building features end-to-end.

This is a hands-on individual contributor role. You'll own features from design collaboration through API implementation to production deployment. We value engineers who leverage modern AI tools to move faster and deliver better results.

General Requirements

  • 3+ years of commercial development experience across frontend and backend
  • AI-first mindset: actively using AI coding assistants and agents in daily workflow to boost productivity and code quality
  • Strong proficiency with Vue.js (Nuxt preferred) or React/Next.js, Javascript and Typescript
  • Ability to own features end-to-end: from understanding requirements to shipping to production with minimal hand-holding
  • Experience building and maintaining design systems or component libraries
  • Experience with edge computing platforms (Cloudflare Workers or similar)
  • Strong async communication skills — you keep others in the loop without being asked
  • Ability to work independently, make decisions, and drive features to completion.

Frontend Requirements

  • Strong proficiency with Vue.js (Nuxt preferred) or React/Next.js
  • Solid JavaScript and TypeScript skills
  • Experience building and maintaining design systems or component libraries.

Backend Requirements

  • Proficiency with Go for building APIs and backend services
  • Experience with PostgreSQL and Redis
  • Familiarity with message brokers (NATS, Kafka, or similar)
  • Understanding of RESTful API design and best practices

Would be a plus

  • Web3 experience: wallet integrations, interacting with blockchain, working with RPC APIs
  • CI/CD and containerization experience (Docker, Kubernetes)
  • Experience with real-time data interfaces (WebSockets, polling, live updates)
  • Experience working directly with product and design teams in a small-team environment

Responsibilities

  • Build and maintain customer-facing dashboard, billing system, internal tools, side-products
  • Design and implement backend APIs and services in Go
  • Collaborate closely with designers to translate Figma specs into polished, accessible UI
  • Work with databases (PostgreSQL, Redis, ArangoDB) to implement efficient data access patterns
  • Coordinate with dedicated backend and frontend engineers on integrations and shared services
  • Write clean, tested, maintainable code with attention to performance and reliability
  • Participate in code reviews and help maintain engineering quality standards
  • Continuously improve development workflows using AI tools and automation

Why GetBlock?

Be Part of Something Bigger

GetBlock builds infrastructure that makes blockchain faster and more accessible worldwide. Our goal is to lead the RPC solutions segment through innovation, flawless uptime, and a personalized approach to clients. We're growing alongside Web3 and invite you to join us!

Remote by Design

Join a fully distributed, international team working across time zones and continents. We believe great talent lives everywhere, and English is our shared language.

Trust over Control

No trackers, no micromanagement. We hire responsible, self-driven professionals who take ownership and make decisions with confidence.

Flexibility that Fits

We embrace the geographical and cultural diversity of our team, allowing you to choose your holiday days and coordinate your schedule with your manager.

Inclusive corporate culture

Monthly town halls, English-speaking clubs, and other corporate events to stay connected and foster team spirit, despite the distance.

Balanced Workload

We maintain a flexible work schedule with approximately 40 hours per week, based on an 8-hour workday. Hours can be adjusted within your department to suit personal preferences and team needs.

We offer

  • Competitive market rate salary with performance-based incentives.
  • 20 days of annual leave, plus an additional 12 days off to use for your holidays or personal days.
  • Well-being programs to support your health and balance.
  • Coworking space compensation for a productive work environment.
  • Paid sick leave to ensure you can rest when needed.
  • A company that invests in your growth, with personalized roadmaps to guide your professional development.
  • An actively growing company with great opportunities for both horizontal and vertical career development.
  • Opportunity to shape the initiatives you’re working on and make a real impact.

title: Lead QA Automation Engineer (SDET) - Brazil
description: This is a remote role based in São Paulo, Brazil RoleWe are looking for a highly experienced Lead QA Automation Engineer (SDET) to architect, build, and scale our test automation framework for a complex, enterprise-grade SaaS platform.

raw.title: Lead QA Automation Engineer (SDET) - Brazil
raw.excerpt: This is a remote role based in São Paulo, Brazil RoleWe are looking for a highly experienced Lead QA Automation Engineer (SDET) to architect, build, and scale our test automation framework for a complex, enterprise-grade SaaS platform.
raw.description:
This is a remote role based in São Paulo, Brazil

Role

We are looking for a highly experienced Lead QA Automation Engineer (SDET) to architect, build, and scale our test automation framework for a complex, enterprise-grade SaaS platform. Our customers include global financial institutions, professional services firms, and military organizations — so reliability, scalability, and security are paramount.

This role is not just about writing tests. It’s about building the foundation of quality engineering: designing automation systems that evolve with the product, scale to enterprise workloads, and provide confidence for mission-critical deployments. The ideal candidate has a proven track record of creating automation frameworks from scratch, scaling them in fast-growing SaaS environments, and mentoring teams to raise the overall quality bar.

Responsibilities

  • Architect and own the test automation framework and infrastructure to support web, API, and integration testing at scale.
  •  Partner with Product, Engineering, and DevOps to ensure testability and quality are baked into requirements, design, and release processes.
  •  Define automation strategy, roadmap, and best practices for the entire organization.
  •  Build and maintain robust regression and smoke test suites that can run reliably across CI/CD pipelines.
  •  Design reporting and analytics dashboards to provide real-time visibility into quality metrics.
  •  Proactively identify gaps in coverage, performance, and resilience; ensure automation scales as the platform grows in complexity.
  •  Mentor and guide QA engineers and SDETs, elevating automation practices across the team.

Skills & Qualifications

  •  Expertise in automation frameworks and architecture (Selenium, Playwright, Cypress, or equivalent).
  •  Senior-level Java skills (or equivalent language proficiency) — ability to design automation frameworks, not just test scripts.
  •  Strong experience with CI/CD pipelines, Git, Jenkins, and quality gates in release management.
  •  Deep understanding of enterprise SaaS application architectures (multi-tenant, API-driven, cloud-based) and their testability challenges.
  •  Proven ability to build automation frameworks from scratch and scale them with product growth.
  •  Familiarity with test management and defect tracking tools (e.g., JIRA, Confluence).
  •  Excellent collaboration skills; proven success working across Product, Engineering, and Operations teams.
  •  Experience testing in regulated, security-sensitive, or mission-critical environments is a strong plus.

Education & Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field (or equivalent experience).
  •  10+ years of QA Automation / SDET experience, with at least 5 years building and scaling automation frameworks in enterprise SaaS.
  • Track record of leading quality initiatives for complex, large-scale solutions used by demanding enterprise customers.

Why Join Us?

At EnterpriseAlumni we work hard, play hard, and always have each other's backs. We offer a fast-paced, innovative, and inclusive environment where creativity is our currency, and every success is celebrated. If you're passionate about a career in technology and ready to make a real impact, we would love to hear from you.

At the heart of our company is EA DNA - the essence that connects our six core values and shapes how we work every day. It guides every decision, behaviour and interaction, and defies the way we do business. When you join us, you become part of a team that truly lives these values: People First, Customer at Our Core, Think Commercially, One Team, Own It, and Urgency. These pronciples shape your experience here - how we support you, how we work together, and how we deliver for our customers.

If you're passionate about a career in technology and ready to make a real impact, we would love to hear from you.

How to Apply:

Interested candidates are invited to submit their resume, in English, and a brief cover letter explaining why they are the perfect fit for this role.

EnterpriseAlumni is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Follow us on LinkedIn to stay up to date on Company news: https://www.linkedin.com/company/enterprisealumni/

NO RECRUITERS PLEASE.

title: General Application
description: About GetBlockGetBlock is building critical infrastructure for the new digital economy.

raw.title: General Application
raw.excerpt: About GetBlockGetBlock is building critical infrastructure for the new digital economy.
raw.description:
About GetBlock

GetBlock is building critical infrastructure for the new digital economy.

We're a Singapore-based company providing bank-grade AI and Web3 infrastructure that powers blockchains, protocols, and applications at global scale.

We're not just another infrastructure provider. We're building rails for new capital flows, enabling autonomous agent systems, and creating the foundation for institutional adoption of Web3 and AI technologies. With 1,000+ bare metal servers and a world-class DevOps team, we run workloads that demand absolute stability, security, and performance.

Our Mission

Right now our focus is on building a talented Web3 team where strong individuals come together to do their best work. With ownership, trust, and high standards, we believe this kind of team can build infrastructure, products, and markets that last.

What We’re Looking For

We’re looking for people who bring strong skills, sound judgment, and a high standard for their work. Specifically, we value:

  • A clear area of strength
    You have skills or experience you’re particularly good at, developed through real, hands-on work.
  • High standards for quality
    You consistently aim for excellent outcomes and take pride in producing reliable, well-thought-out work.
  • Experimental and AI-focused mindset
    You continuously experiment with new approaches and actively use AI and modern tools to deliver faster, smarter, and higher-quality outcomes.
  • An ownership mindset
    You take responsibility for identifying problems, proposing solutions, and seeing work through without needing constant direction.
  • Strong execution speed
    You can move quickly and decisively while still maintaining quality and reliability.

Ready to Apply?

If you didn’t find a role that’s a perfect match, we still want to hear from you.

Fill out a form or upload a short video intro to help us understand how you think, what you’ve built, and why GetBlock interests you.

We review every submission and will reach out if there’s a strong alignment with what we’re building.

What Makes Us Different

GetBlock has been building since Q4 2019. What started with two BSC full nodes has grown into a Singapore-headquartered top 5 Web3 infrastructure platform leading in user engagement, network coverage, and customer support excellence.

We didn't get here by playing it safe. Our foundation is built on bold experimentation, constant exploration, and rolling up our sleeves to do the work. We're not afraid to test new ideas, learn from failures, and surprise the Web3 world with innovative solutions.

We adapt faster than the market shifts. We push boundaries while others settle for comfort. That's how a lean, hungry team can compete with giants backed by eleven-digit valuations.

Our team is our only secret sauce. We bet big on trailblazers and challengers who are curious, ambitious, and committed to building something exceptional together.

We're looking for people who share our mission: to build the best Web3 and AI infrastructure company on the planet.

If that sounds like you, let's build together.

  • Implement data access layers using Entity Framework and Dapper
  • Optimize database queries and ensure data integrity in MS SQL Server
  • Write and maintain unit tests using XUnit/NUnit/Moq to ensure code quality
  • Collaborate with front-end developers, QA engineers, and business analysts to deliver high-quality solutions
  • Participate in code reviews, provide constructive feedback, and follow best practices
  • Work closely with the customer to clarify requirements and propose technical solutions
  • Contribute to continuous improvement of development processes and tools
  • At least 3 years of experience in commercial software development with .NET technologies
  • Strong knowledge of ASP.NET Core and C#
  • Experience working with MS SQL Server and relational database design
  • Proficiency in ORM tools such as EntityFramework or Dapper
  • Experience with unit testing frameworks (XUnit, NUnit, Moq)
  • Understanding of network fundamentals and application security basics
  • Hands-on experience with version control systems, preferably Git
  • Upper-Intermediate level of English, with ability to participate in active communication with the customer and team

WILLBE A PLUS

  • Experience with Swagger and Postman
  • Experience with AI Prompting

PERSONAL PROFILE

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders
  • Strong problem-solving and decision-making skills, with a focus on driving results and meeting deadlines
  • Self-motivated, adaptable, and eager to learn new technologies and frameworks

Are you a skilled .NET Developer ready to take on a meaningful challenge? We are looking for a Middle/Strong Middle specialist to join our European-based team and work remotely on a high-impact platform that drives employee engagement and motivation.

At Sigma Software, we collaborate with forward-thinking clients to deliver innovative, scalable solutions. In this role, you will be part of a modernization initiative that will shape the future of an employee recognition platform serving hundreds of users.

Join us to work with modern technologies, contribute to a product that makes a difference, and enjoy a supportive environment with opportunities for growth and professional development.

CUSTOMER
Our client is a US-based company specializing in employee recognition and incentive programs. They design and manage solutions that help organizations boost engagement, motivation, and performance through customized rewards and loyalty programs. The company serves a diverse range of clients, helping them foster positive workplace culture and achieve measurable results through tailored engagement strategies.

PROJECT
We are partnering with the customer to deliver a full-scale modernization of their current platform. The goal is to meet growing demand and ensure scalability for diverse needs of existing and new customers. This is a high-impact product serving hundreds of users, offering you the chance to contribute to a solution that directly influences employee motivation and organizational success.

title: Splicing & As-Built Technician
description: Splicing & As-Built Technician | Ripple Fiber We are looking for a Splicing & As-Built Technician to join our growing team.

raw.title: Splicing & As-Built Technician
raw.excerpt: Splicing & As-Built Technician | Ripple Fiber We are looking for a Splicing & As-Built Technician to join our growing team.
raw.description:
Splicing & As-Built Technician | Ripple Fiber

We are looking for a Splicing & As-Built Technician to join our growing team. This position will cover all of the Ripple markets and may require travel to the various markets as needed.

About Ripple Fiber

At Ripple Fiber, we deliver more than high-speed internet. We’re creating a ripple effect by producing opportunities and brighter futures for the residents of the communities we serve. Join America’s most innovative, industry-leading fiber internet company, and help shape the future.

We believe the biggest wave starts as a ripple.

About our culture

We are a dynamic, fast-growing, and innovative company driven by ambitious self-starters with entrepreneurial mindsets. Our fast-paced environment fosters creativity, collaboration, and initiative. We are people-centric, placing strong emphasis on employee experience, career growth, and professional development.

Position Summary:

The OSP Redline & As-Built Technician is responsible for managing and maintaining accurate records of all redlines, as-builts, and splicing documentation for fiber network projects. This role ensures that all field updates, design changes, and splicing records are captured, verified, and properly integrated into GIS and OSP documentation systems. The specialist serves as the bridge between the field construction team, design engineers, and GIS staff to ensure network data integrity and compliance with company standards.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Review, update, and maintain redline drawings to reflect field changes during construction.
  • Create and finalize as-built documentation upon project completion, ensuring accuracy and completeness.
  • Collect, organize, and document splicing information from field splicers, including fiber assignments, splice diagrams.
  • Collaborate with design engineers and field teams to reconcile discrepancies between design and field conditions.
  • Verify splicing documentation aligns with network design and routing plans.
  • Generate deliverables for internal and external stakeholders, including final map packages and splicing records.
  • Maintain document version control and ensure all project documentation meets company and client standards.
  • Support the Quality Control (QC) process for as-built submissions.
  • Assist in developing and improving documentation standards and workflows.

Experience:

  • 2+ years of experience in fiber splicing, OSP construction, or OSP documentation.
  • Experience with OSP design software such as ArcGIS, and AutoCAD

Knowledge:

  • Understanding of fiber optic splicing, network architecture (FTTH, backbone, distribution), and OSP terminology.
  • Familiar with reading and interpreting construction drawings, splice schematics, and fiber assignment sheets.

Skills:

  • Strong attention to detail and documentation accuracy.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office and Adobe tools.
  • Excellent communication and coordination skills across departments.

Preferred:

  • Experience with ISP or telecom construction environments.
  • Familiarity with PON (GPON/XGS-PON) networks and OLT/FDH configurations.
  • Prior field splicing experience or background in OSP design QC.

We offer competitive pay, comprehensive health benefits, 401(k) with company match, and a supportive work environment where innovation and teamwork thrive. If you’re passionate about making a difference and being part of a community-focused company, Ripple Fiber is the place for you.

Ripple Fiber is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that no one should be discriminated against because of their differences, such as age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, religion, or sexual orientation. All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law. Ripple Fiber is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.

title: Environment Concept Artist
description: What is your role? As an Environment Concept Artist at Eleventh Hour Games, you will help define and expand the visual identity of our worlds.

raw.title: Environment Concept Artist
raw.excerpt: What is your role? As an Environment Concept Artist at Eleventh Hour Games, you will help define and expand the visual identity of our worlds.
raw.description:
What is your role?

As an Environment Concept Artist at Eleventh Hour Games, you will help define and expand the visual identity of our worlds. You will create high-quality environment concepts that establish mood, scale, architecture, and environmental storytelling for Last Epoch universe.

In this role you will collaborate closely with Art Direction, Environment Art, Design, and Production to translate high-level creative vision into clear, actionable concepts that support gameplay, narrative, and technical constraints.

Responsibilities:

  • Create environment concept art that defines locations, biomes, architecture, landmarks, and points of interest
  • Establish mood, lighting, color palettes, and material language to support world-building and narrative tone
  • Produce a range of deliverables, including keyframes, paint-overs, mood boards, color scripts, and production-ready callouts
  • Collaborate with Art Direction to explore visual directions and iterate based on feedback
  • Partner with Environment Artists to ensure concepts are clear, practical, and translatable into in-game assets
  • Work closely with Design to align environments with gameplay needs, readability, and player flow
  • Support live development by creating concepts for new content, expansions, and seasonal updates
  • Maintain visual consistency across environments while introducing fresh ideas and variation
  • Contribute to and help refine environment art documentation and style guides
  • Participate in reviews and critiques, offering constructive feedback to peers

Qualifications:

  • 2+ years of professional experience as an Environment Concept Artist in games, film, or related industries
  • Understanding of environment design, composition, perspective, lighting, and color theory
  • Ability to create clear, production-focused concepts that support downstream art teams
  • Experience collaborating with art directors, environment artists, and designers in a production setting
  • Proficiency with industry-standard tools (Photoshop, Procreate, Blender, or similar)
  • Ability to work iteratively, incorporate feedback, and meet deadlines in a fast-moving environment
  • Strong visual storytelling skills and a passion for world-building
  • Comfortable working in a fully remote, globally distributed team

Pluses:

  • Experience working on ARPGs, dark fantasy settings, or stylized realism
  • Familiarity with live-service development and ongoing content production
  • Knowledge of Unreal Engine or Unity pipelines and how concept art supports them

Why Eleventh Hour Games?

EHG is a fast growing studio, focused on a passion for top-down action RPGs. We value open communication, close-knit teamwork, and opportunity for ownership and growth! Our mission is to gather and empower the next generation of creators to forge extraordinary games. Extraordinary games build passionate communities, which create passionate people. Passionate people turn into next year's creators. With our breakout title Last Epoch,we are moving fast into the next round of adventure!

  • Flexible fully remote working arrangement
  • 35 paid time off days at the start of each year for U.S. based employees
  • Dental, Vision for U.S. based employees + dependents
  • 90% paid health coverage premiums for U.S. based employees and 100% premium paid for dependents health insurance
  • 401K for U.S. based employees

EHG is an equal opportunity employer. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, please contact HR@eleventhhour.games. Please note, general employment questions cannot be accepted or processed this way.

raw.title: Marketing Manager
raw.excerpt: Marketing Manager (Sparkfly)Unique opportunity with a rapidly expanding customer engagement technology leader Sparkfly helps marketers create lasting relationships with their customers by helping them understand customer engagement on a 1:1 level.
raw.description:
Marketing Manager (Sparkfly)

Unique opportunity with a rapidly expanding customer engagement technology leader

Sparkfly helps marketers create lasting relationships with their customers by helping them understand customer engagement on a 1:1 level. Through Sparkfly's Offer Management and Loyalty technology, marketers gain insight into the revenue-linked performance of their campaigns via actual customer behaviors. Our SaaS platform enables marketers to create data-driven customer engagement strategies that are proven to attract and retain customers and drive revenue growth for their businesses. To learn more about Sparkfly, visit www.sparkfly.com.

We are currently seeking a creative and results-driven Marketing Manager to elevate Sparkfly's brand presence and drive demand generation initiatives. The ideal candidate will have proven experience in B2B SaaS marketing, with strong capabilities in content creation, social media management, public relations, and campaign execution. This individual will excel at translating complex technical concepts into compelling narratives that resonate with C-suite executives at marquee, multi-unit enterprise brands in QSR, retail, convenience store, and salon industries.

The Marketing Manager will report directly to the SVP of Revenue & Growth to create marketing assets that support business development efforts and accelerate pipeline growth. This role can be located anywhere in the continental United States. Travel will be required but is limited to industry conferences and client meetings. Compensation will be based on experience and demonstrated marketing results.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop and execute comprehensive marketing campaigns that drive brand awareness and generate qualified leads for Sparkfly's offer management and loyalty solutions
  • Create compelling content across multiple formats including case studies, white papers, blog posts, email campaigns, sales collateral, and presentation decks that articulate Sparkfly's value proposition
  • Manage Sparkfly's social media presence across LinkedIn, Twitter, and other relevant platforms, developing engaging content that showcases thought leadership and customer success stories
  • Coordinate public relations efforts including press releases, media outreach, industry awards submissions, and analyst relations to increase Sparkfly's visibility in the martech ecosystem
  • Partner with sales leadership to understand prospect needs and create targeted marketing materials that address specific industry challenges and use cases
  • Manage Sparkfly's website content, ensuring messaging is current, compelling, and optimized for lead generation and SEO
  • Plan and execute Sparkfly's presence at industry conferences and events, including promotional materials, pre-event campaigns, and post-event follow-up
  • Develop customer testimonials, video content, and reference materials that demonstrate Sparkfly's impact on revenue growth and customer engagement
  • Track and analyze marketing campaign performance using analytics tools, providing regular reports on lead generation, website traffic, social engagement, and ROI
  • Collaborate with the product team to develop go-to-market strategies for new features and platform enhancements
  • Manage relationships with external vendors including designers, PR agencies, content creators, and event coordinators
  • Maintain brand consistency across all marketing channels and materials, serving as the guardian of Sparkfly's brand voice and visual identity

Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of marketing experience in B2B SaaS, martech, or enterprise technology companies
  • Demonstrated success in developing and executing multi-channel marketing campaigns that drive measurable business results
  • Exceptional writing and storytelling abilities with a portfolio of marketing content that showcases ability to simplify complex technical concepts
  • Strong social media management skills with experience building engaged audiences on professional platforms, particularly LinkedIn
  • Experience with marketing automation platforms (Zoho, other), CRM systems (Monday), and analytics tools (Google Analytics)
  • Proven ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously with minimal oversight
  • Creative mindset with strong attention to detail and commitment to producing high-quality marketing materials including proficiencies in PowerPoint and tools such as Claude, invideo, Canva, etc.
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment where priorities can shift quickly
  • Experience in the restaurant technology, retail technology, or customer engagement platform space is highly desirable
  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or related field
  • Willingness to travel approximately 10-15% for conferences and team meetings

About Sparkfly Sparkfly is a technology company that provides digital marketing solutions, focusing on creating and managing customer engagement and loyalty programs for brands such as Chipotle, Texas Roadhouse, Shake Shack, First Watch, Bojangles, and more. We offer a platform that enables businesses to deliver personalized offers, track customer interactions in real-time, and analyze campaign effectiveness. Our services are designed to help companies enhance customer experiences, increase sales, and improve marketing ROI through better data insights and targeted promotions. Our platform integrates with a vast network of point-of-sale systems and digital marketing channels, allowing seamless execution of marketing strategies.

We believe in working together with our customers, seeking solutions that make their businesses better. We don't consider ourselves a run-of-the-mill "tech solutions provider." We're problem solvers with unique experience, knowledge and answers, focused on making digital marketing work in the real world.

Our approach starts with our turnkey, patent-protected, technology platform that integrates directly with a merchant's Point of Sale system, connecting the digital and physical marketing worlds in real-time. Our success is driven by a great team that focuses on customer satisfaction and return on investment.

title: Integration Manager, Card Acquiring
description: Hi!  We’re Mercuryo, and we’re on a mission to redefine finance by blending the best of traditional banking with the innovations of decentralized finance (DeFi).

raw.title: Integration Manager, Card Acquiring
raw.excerpt: Hi!  We’re Mercuryo, and we’re on a mission to redefine finance by blending the best of traditional banking with the innovations of decentralized finance (DeFi).
raw.description:
Hi! We’re Mercuryo, and we’re on a mission to redefine finance by blending the best of traditional banking with the innovations of decentralized finance (DeFi). We believe that everyone should have easy access to Web3 and traditional financial services — and we’re making that happen by building a robust platform that simplifies dealing with crypto and seamlessly integrates it into the broader financial ecosystem.

Since we launched in 2018, we’ve teamed up with Web3 top projects such as MetaMask, Trust Wallet, Ledger, Jupiter, 1inch, and PancakeSwap and 200+ others to power over 200 dynamic products. Our work also brings us into direct collaboration with major ecosystems such as Solana Labs, Consensys, and BNB Chain. We’re just getting started, and we want you to help us shape the future of money!

Why Mercuryo?

Industry Impact

Join us in helping world-class Web3 projects onboard millions of new users into the next generation of finance.

Innovative Environment

Collaborate with more than 200 talented professionals from diverse backgrounds — including banking, SaaS, and Web3 — all united in delivering outstanding user experiences.

Growth and Learning

Our expanding network of 200+ B2B partnerships and a user base of over 7 million means there’s always room to grow your skills, tackle new challenges, and push boundaries.

Flexible Culture

We’re remote-first, celebrating diversity across 30 countries. At Mercuryo, you’ll be empowered to take ownership of your work, spark creativity, and shape how we move forward together.

Your Role:

  • Interaction with new partners to connect acquiring cards and other products.
  • Consultation of technical integration partners.
  • Maintaining and updating documentation.
  • Assigning tasks for revision to the development department as part of technical integration with partners.
  • Monitoring and control of the implementation of the integration process.

What We’re Looking For:

  • Experience in payment processing or Internet acquiring in a similar position for at least 2 years.
  • Experience as a system analyst / system integrator / product / project in fintech.
  • Understanding how APIs are arranged (protocols, formats of transmitted data).
  • Knowledge of payment specifications.
  • Understanding of Javascript.
  • English level from B2+.
  • Knowledge of Postman API or similar is an advantage.
  • Analytical thinking and attention to detail.

What We Offer:

  • Competitive market rate salary and performance-based incentives.
  • 22 days annual leave with an additional 6 company days, plus bank holidays.
  • Comprehensive health insurance plans.
  • Extensive Benefits program.
  • Flexible work schedule and remote work options.
  • Professional development and training opportunities.
  • Opportunity to shape the initiatives you’re working on.
  • Diverse and friendly team.
  • We are open-minded to new ideas.

Join Us!

If you're driven to be a part of the Web3 forefront and are keen to leave your mark on this rapidly evolving field, Mercuryo is an excellent choice. Discover our open positions and see how you can contribute to shaping the future!

Mercuryo is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We are committed to providing employees with a work environment that is progressive and open-minded. Our employment philosophy is to hire the best people and empower them to do the best work of their lives. Employment decisions are based on business needs and individual merit, without regard to race, colour, religion, ethnicity, sexual orientation, nationality, marital status, gender, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Mercuryo is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations during the application process for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you require assistance to complete your application, please contact our Talent Team.

title: Sr. Manager, Deal Desk & Sales Compensation
description: At Securonix, we’re on a mission to secure the world by staying ahead of cyber threats, reinforcing all layers of our platform with AI capabilities.

raw.title: Sr. Manager, Deal Desk & Sales Compensation
raw.excerpt: At Securonix, we’re on a mission to secure the world by staying ahead of cyber threats, reinforcing all layers of our platform with AI capabilities.
raw.description:
At Securonix, we’re on a mission to secure the world by staying ahead of cyber threats, reinforcing all layers of our platform with AI capabilities. Our Securonix Unified Defense SIEM provides organizations with the first and only AI-Reinforced solution built with a cybersecurity mesh architecture on a highly scalable data cloud. Enhanced by Securonix EON’s AI capabilities, our innovative cloud-native solution delivers a seamless CyberOps experience, empowering organizations to scale their security operations and keep up with evolving threats.

Recognized as a five-time leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for SIEM and highly rated on Gartner Peer Insights, our award-winning Unified Defense SIEM provides organizations with 365 days of ‘hot’ data for rapid search and investigation, threat content-as-a-service, proactive defense through continuous peer and partner collaboration, and a fully integrated Threat Detection, Investigation, and Response (TDIR) experience—all within a single platform. Built on a cloud-native architecture, the platform leverages the Snowflake Data Cloud for unparalleled scalability and performance.

Securonix is proud to be a cybersecurity unicorn and featured in CRN's 2024 Security 100 list. Backed by Vista Equity Partners, one of the largest private equity firms with over $100 billion in assets under management, we have a unique advantage in driving innovation and growth. With a global footprint, we serve more than 1,000 customers worldwide, including 10% of the Fortune 100. Our network of 150+ partners and Managed Security Service Providers (MSSPs) enables us to deliver unmatched security solutions on a global scale.

At Securonix, we are driven by our core values and place our people at the heart of everything we do:

  • Winning as One Team: We work together with universal respect to achieve aligned outcomes
  • Customer Driven Innovation: We innovate to stay ahead of the market and create value for our customers
  • Agility in Action: We embrace change and are unified in our purpose and objectives amidst change

POSITION SUMMARY:

The Senior Manager, Deal Desk and Sales Compensation owns the company’s deal governance, quoting execution, and sales compensation operations, ensuring revenue is closed efficiently, accurately, and in alignment with financial and strategic objectives. This role serves as the central authority for quote-to-close, partnering closely with Sales, Finance, Legal, and Product to structure complex deals, enforce pricing discipline, and accelerate deal velocity—while ensuring downstream accuracy in bookings and compensation.You will design and run a scalable Deal Desk operating model, enforce clear approval frameworks and SLAs, and lead a small team of analysts responsible for day-to-day deal execution and compensation administration. This is a fast-paced, high-impact role critical to revenue predictability and margin protection.

POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:

Deal Desk Ownership & Quoting Execution

  • Own the end-to-end Deal Desk function, including quote creation, pricing guidance, discount governance, approvals, and deal exception management
  • Serve as the primary point of contact for non-standard, high-value, multi-year, partner, and complex deals
  • Define and enforce pricing and discounting frameworks, guardrails, and approval hierarchies in partnership with Finance and Sales leadership
  • Establish clear SLAs, escalation paths, and decision rights to balance speed with control
  • Partner with Legal and Finance to ensure accurate deal terms, revenue recognition readiness, and compliance prior to close
  • Drive continuous improvement in deal cycle time, win rates, and margin outcomes

Quote-to-Close Process & Systems

  • Own and optimize the quote-to-close process, ensuring consistency, auditability, and scalability
  • Act as business owner for quoting tools and process including quote configuration logic, pricing rules and approval workflows, and continuously updated SKU catalog.
  • Identify and resolve friction points in quoting workflows that slow sales execution
  • Partner with Enablement to ensure reps understand quoting policies, deal desk engagement models, and expectations

Sales Compensation Management

  • Own sales compensation operations, ensuring accurate alignment between:
    • Deal structure and booking treatment
    • Quotas, crediting rules, and payout calculations
  • Partner with Finance and Sales leadership on comp plan design, documentation, and annual planning
  • Manage compensation administration, audits, exception handling, and dispute resolution
  • Ensure compensation outcomes reinforce desired selling behaviors and pricing discipline
  • Maintain strong controls to ensure accurate, timely, and compliant payouts

People Leadership & Team Management

  • Directly manage and develop analysts in both the Deal Desk and Sales Compensation functions
  • Set clear priorities, performance expectations, and SLAs for analyst-owned workflows
  • Provide coaching, training, and career development to build a high-performing, scalable team
  • Delegate deal execution and compensation administration appropriately while retaining oversight of high-risk or high-value items
  • Establish coverage models and escalation paths to ensure consistent support for Sales

Cross-Functional Leadership & Governance

  • Act as a trusted advisor to Sales leadership on deal strategy, tradeoffs, and risk
  • Establish governance across pricing, quoting, and compensation to ensure consistency and transparency
  • Document policies, processes, and decision frameworks to support scale and onboarding
  • Lead change management for new deal structures, pricing models, or compensation changes
  • Provide actionable insights to leadership to improve deal quality and revenue predictability

REQUIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:

  • 4+ years of experience in Deal Desk, Revenue Operations, Sales Operations, or Pricing Operations
  • Prior experience managing or mentoring analysts in an operations function
  • Demonstrated ownership of quote-to-close processes in a B2B or SaaS environment
  • Strong experience with quoting tools and tool management
  • Proven ability to manage pricing governance, approvals, and complex deal structures
  • Experience owning or heavily influencing sales compensation design and administration
  • Excellent judgment, attention to detail, and ability to operate under time pressure

BENEFITS:

  • Our medical insurance is with Cigna as we offer 4 plans to choose from. Our vision and dental insurance are both PPO plans.
  • Securonix pays for your STD, LTD and Basic Life AD&D benefit.
  • Securonix also provides you access to the Employee Assistance Program (EAP) at no cost. This program, available through Mutual of Omaha, provides professional, confidential telephonic or face-to-face counseling services to you and your loved ones.
  • With our 401(K) you are eligible to participate the 1st of the month, following 60 days of employment.
  • At Securonix we offer a Flexible Time Off plan, please speak to one of our Talent Attraction Specialists for details.

Securonix is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an innovative, inclusive, diverse and discrimination-free work environment. Employment with Securonix is based on merit, competence, and qualifications. It is our policy to administer all personnel actions, including recruiting, hiring, training, and promoting employees, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin or ancestry, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, or any other legally protected classification in accordance with applicable federal and state laws. Consistent with the obligations of these laws, Securonix will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

Furthermore, as a federal government contractor, Securonix maintains an affirmative action program which furthers its commitment and complies with recordkeeping and reporting requirements under certain federal civil rights laws and regulations, including Executive Order 11246, Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 (as amended) and the Vietnam Era Veterans' Readjustment Assistance Act of 1974 (as amended).

As part of our compliance with these obligations, Securonix invites you to voluntarily self-identify as set forth below. Provision of such information is entirely voluntary and a decision to provide or not provide such information will not have any effect on your employment or subject you to any adverse treatment. Any and all information provided will be considered confidential, will be kept separate from your application and/or personnel file, and will only be used in accordance with applicable laws, orders and regulations, including those that require the information to be summarized and reported to the federal government for civil rights enforcement purposes.

raw.title: Indoor Air Quality Technician
raw.excerpt: One Hour Heating & Air Conditioning, an affiliate of Authority Brands Inc.
raw.companyName: One Hour Heating & Air Conditioning Corporate Store
raw.description:
One Hour Heating & Air Conditioning, an affiliate of Authority Brands Inc., is the premier heating and cooling specialist in the Las Vegas area. We are looking for an Indoor Air Quality Technician to perform semi-skilled and skilled work in the installation and cleaning of HVAC systems. The IAQ Apprentice provides exceptional customer service and educates customers regarding technical and investment decisions by providing multiple options and solutions while installing and cleaning in customer's homes.

What can joining the One Hour team offer you?

The opportunity you deserve to build your career with a well-established company. We prioritize promoting from within!

Competitive pay rates, your own service van, and dispatching primarily from home.

A best-in-the-industry benefits package that includes generous PTO, health, dental, vision and 401k with company match!

Responsibilities:

Analyze the HVAC system within a structure and develop an appropriate cleaning plan.

Properly perform a duct sealing process

Basic ductwork installation, filters, plenums and grilles.

System improvement and maintenance suggestions pertaining to the HVAC system to the customer.

Effectively offer system enhancements to clients that will benefit them or their system.

Complete daily paperwork in a timely manner and submit for billing.

Qualifications:

High school diploma or GED required.

Experience with ductwork replacement, duct cleanings, dryer vent cleaning, filter cabinet installations, Aeroseal, Decon7, dryer vent cleaning, and filter cabinet installations required.

Certifications preferred but not required.

Ability to communicate effectively and courteously with customers a must.

Ability to take work direction from crew leader in courteous manner required.

Must have appropriate trade tools.

Valid driver's license and a clean driving record required.

Must be able to pass a background check and drug screen.

Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions; however, we do not sponsor visas at this time.

Authority Brands Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Each franchise location is independently owned and operated by a franchisee. Your application will go directly to the franchisee, and all hiring decisions will be made by the management of this franchisee. The franchisee sets their own compensation and benefits. All inquiries about employment, benefits, scheduling, and compensation at this franchise should be made directly to the franchise location, and not to One Hour Heating and Air Conditioning Corporate.

raw.description:
IntellectEU is an international technology company focused on digital finance and emerging technologies. At IntellectEU we are on a mission to become the top-of-mind fintech company. We are committed to our people and believe in building a better future with the newest of the newest technologies. Giving young people and industry veterans a growing ground to play, launch ideas & work very closely with our clients. With our hands-on experience in both technical & capital markets, there’s no challenge that’s left untackled. Since 2006 we have been focused on financial messaging and integration, being a SWIFT service partner.

We are seeking a visionary leader to head IntellectEU's AI services program and drive initiatives in Payment Modernization and Capital Markets Innovation. The AI Program Manager will define and execute the program’s vision, strategic roadmap, and budget while cultivating innovation and measurable business impact. This role requires a strong foundation in AI/ML, model lifecycle management, MLOps, data governance, and data pipelines, combined with proven experience in program leadership and stakeholder engagement.

Responsibilities

  • Develop and communicate a vision, strategic plan, and budget for the Program, ensuring alignment with the company’s overall goals.
  • Define and oversee annual and semi-annual program goals in collaboration with key stakeholders.
  • Collaborate with the Sales team to achieve revenue and profit targets, including defining strategic business areas, providing training, and supporting presale efforts.
  • Define, monitor, and control KPIs that align with strategic plans while ensuring revenue and profit targets are met.
  • Oversee program performance, including budget management and project marginality tracking.
  • Develop and maintain resource planning and forecasting models in collaboration with the Finance team.
  • Allocate and manage program resources, ensuring optimal deployment based on priorities and company needs.
  • Facilitate smooth transitions of resources across programs in collaboration with other Program Managers.
  • Approve hiring or termination requests to align with program resources and financial goals.

Technical skills

Must Have:

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in information technology, computer science, engineering, management, or a related field.
  • 5+ years of experience in an AI leadership role, such as team lead, project manager, Product Manager, or similar capacity.
  • Fluent English written and spoken.
  • Experience in client management and relationship building.
  • Strong technical background with knowledge of Software development processes, IT infrastructure and related technologies and relevant technologies in Payments Modernization.
  • In-depth understanding of AI usage in payments, securities, and trade finance.
  • Strong knowledge of AI/ML fundamentals (classification, NLP, generative models),
  • Solid grasp of Model lifecycle management (training, evaluation, deployment, monitoring)
  • Deep understanding of MLOps practices such as CI/CD pipelines, containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).
  • Fluency in data governance, data pipelines (ETL/ELT), feature engineering, and scalable infrastructure design to ensure robust and reliable AI solutions.
  • Strong negotiation skills to manage client expectations, address concerns, and find mutually beneficial solutions.
  • Excellent communication skills to articulate ideas clearly and effectively.

We guarantee:

  • International experience in a stable company: the company has offices in Antwerp, Lisbon, Krakow Kyiv, New York and operates on the market for over 15 years.
  • Passionate team in an innovative casual, positive, and open work environment ready to meet your new ideas.
  • Great opportunities for personal and professional development as well as the chance to change the way the business works in the financial world.
  • Work where you're most productive: remote, in-office, or hybrid options available.

title: National Business Development Manager - LNG (Miami, FL, US, 33125)
description: At Endress+Hauser, progress happens by working together.

raw.title: National Business Development Manager - LNG (Miami, FL, US, 33125)
raw.excerpt: At Endress+Hauser, progress happens by working together.
raw.description:
At Endress+Hauser, progress happens by working together. As the global leader in measurement instrumentation, our ~17,000 employees shape the future in the field of process automation. Whether developing and realizing new technology as a team, collaborating to build instrumentation, or strengthening vital relationships with countless global industries, we work to create trusted relationships that help everyone thrive. As a family-owned company, we look beyond short-term moves and work to create a vision that is forward-thinking for our people, our clients, and the world at large.  

What is the role about?

The Business Development Manager – LNG & Marine will drive strategic growth by expanding Endress+Hauser’s market presence, increasing revenue, and strengthening key customer relationships within the LNG and Marine sectors. This role will collaborate with leadership, global sales teams, and representative partners to identify and secure high-value projects, enhance customer engagement, and align business strategies across regions. By leveraging industry expertise and strategic account management, this position will play a critical role in positioning Endress+Hauser as a trusted partner in the LNG and Marine industries.

Which tasks will you perform?

  • Develop and implement strategic growth plans to drive revenue, increase market share, and enhance Endress+Hauser’s position within the LNG and Marine sectors.
  • Identify, qualify, and execute a multimillion-dollar pipeline annually, ensuring sustainable long-term business growth through strategic project acquisition and account development.
  • Collaborate with leadership, global Endress+Hauser teams, and the sales force to determine and target key accounts, aligning efforts across regions for maximum impact.
  • Identify and engage key decision-makers at both corporate and plant levels, including purchasing, engineering, operations, and maintenance teams, to establish strong partnerships and long-term business relationships.
  • Leverage deep industry knowledge to identify customer needs and pain points, providing tailored solutions that drive value, competitive differentiation, and operational efficiency.
  • Strengthen project acquisition efforts by working closely with Endress+Hauser’s representative partners, and Project Pursuit Managers to align strategies and maximize business opportunities.
  • Work cross-functionally with international Sales Centers and Production Centers to ensure seamless global account coverage, fostering collaboration and consistency in customer engagement.
  • Lead and mentor a select team of territory sales representatives, equipping them with the industry expertise, technical knowledge, and strategic guidance needed to drive market penetration and customer success.
  • Develop and execute targeted account growth strategies, analyzing key customer spending patterns, identifying opportunities for formal agreements, and securing long-term partnerships.
  • Deliver high-impact executive-level presentations and facilitate technology and account reviews, effectively communicating Endress+Hauser’s value proposition and positioning the company as a trusted partner in LNG and Marine.

What do we expect from you?

You will have (required):

  • Bachelor’s degree in business or a technical field with 7+ years of relevant experience in the LNG and Marine industry, or 10+ years of industry experience in business development, sales, or a related role within the LNG and Marine industry.
  • Travel required: up to 50%

You may have (preferred):

  • Ability to navigate ambiguity, develop and execute strategic plans and solutions, and drive business results.
  • Proactively offers, seeks, and applies constructive feedback with an openness to growth and collaboration.
  • Demonstrates trust, respect, and support for others, fostering teamwork and a collaborative spirit.
  • Collaborates effectively with others, sometimes across departments, to achieve organizational goals and enhance customer experience.
  • Demonstrates enthusiasm and self-motivation, taking pride in their work and channeling energy into achieving tasks with a strong sense of ownership.
  • Exceptional leadership skills with a proven ability to inspire and influence teams, build trust and credibility, and effectively coach and guide individuals without relying on formal authority.
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, capable of presenting information clearly, articulating complex technical issues, and engaging with individuals at all levels.

What can you expect from us?

  • Family-owned, friendly, and highly committed company  
  • Tuition reimbursement and a wide range of development opportunities 
  • Comprehensive benefits package which includes medical, dental and vision 
  • Competitive compensation and bonus opportunities 
  • Generous paid time off 
  • Life insurance and 401(k) savings with company match 
  • Full-service café, fitness center, and health clinic (in Greenwood, IN)

The anticipated pay range for this role is $121,600 to $187,300 per year. Exact compensation may vary depending on the education, skills, and experience each candidate brings to the role.

Endress+Hauser is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of any protected classification including protected veteran and disability status.
