raw.description:
About By Association Only (BAO)

BAO is a globally award-winning Shopify Plus eCommerce agency based in the UK. We’re a senior team of designers, developers and marketers that are committed to exceptional standards in eCommerce. We work explicitly with Shopify Plus merchants - generally in the fashion, cosmetics and luxury goods sectors for brands all over the world in competitive global markets.

We work in a studio where independence, autonomy and doing the right thing is at the centre of everything we do. As an agency we’re on a mission to work with the world's most ambitious eCommerce brands and we do this in an environment that is smart, open, fast-paced, fun and rewarding.

Although we're headquartered in Cambridge, we are staffed by around 70% permanently remote employees that are located all over the UK. All of our team members are full time employees.

Job Summary

We’re looking for talented, conscientious, and ambitious developers who want to work on exciting e-Commerce projects for global brands. We’re drawn to people who are naturally curious, enjoy problem solving, and share our ambition to build a global agency with a reputation for excellence in both product and service.

Skills / Experience

We feel passionately that the role will excite the right individual due to the opportunity to work with some fantastic brands, from ambitious funded startups through to large enterprise merchants across a wide variety of market sectors.

  • Hands-on experience working with an e-Commerce platform such as Shopify, Magento, or BigCommerce
  • At least 2 years experience contributing to active projects/websites
  • Ability to write well-structured, semantic, and accessible HTML and CSS
  • An excellent understanding of JavaScript, with strong knowledge of Web Components
  • Solid understanding of core web development principles and front-end performance best practices
  • Building complex interactions in a performant way, with a high degree of polish
  • Strong awareness of WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility requirements
  • Experience working with modern web stacks including build tools, transpilers, linters, build and CI tools
  • Solid understanding of Git and version control and working within a team of multiple developers

Bonus Points for:

  • Working in an agency or creative studio environment delivering websites for a variety of clients
  • Hands-on technical experience with an e-Commerce platform
  • A deep understanding of one or more specific client-side areas like animation, performance, or accessibility for example
  • Experience with a common back-end language or framework, preferably Ruby or Node

Benefits

  • Highly competitive salary DOE
  • 20 days of annual leave + 8 bank holidays
  • + 1 extra day per year served
  • + 3/4 'BAO Thank You' Days (additional annual leave) each year around the Xmas period
  • High-spec computer equipment issued from day 1
  • Training budget for courses or online training relevant to your role
  • Interesting, high-profile clients
  • No micro-management culture
  • Flexible remote working or office based or a combination of the two - depending on your location and preference
  • Social events throughout the year
  • Clear career progression paths with a Banding structure specific to all Web Developer roles

- - - - - -

Become part of our Carbon Positive workforce

Every one of our staff members are climate positive. BAO contributes a monthly payment per employee, planting trees around the world on behalf of its team. This means as an employee of BAO you’ll be offsetting your entire carbon footprint, including emissions from your home, personal travel, holidays, food, hobbies and more.

NO AGENCIES PLEASE - SERIOUSLY!

Salary: Highly competitive salary DOE

title: Estimator (Substations)
description: Our Substations group is currently looking to add an Estimator to our growing team, based in Calgary, AB; Vaughan, ON; or potentially working remotely from another location in Canada.

raw.title: Estimator (Substations)
raw.excerpt: Our Substations group is currently looking to add an Estimator to our growing team, based in Calgary, AB; Vaughan, ON; or potentially working remotely from another location in Canada.
raw.description:
Our Substations group is currently looking to add an Estimator to our growing team, based in Calgary, AB; Vaughan, ON; or potentially working remotely from another location in Canada.

Reporting to the Manager, Substation Estimating, we are seeking an experienced estimator who has knowledge and experience in Electrical Utility Construction with a strong preference for experience with Substations or Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) projects. Proven ability compiling cost estimates, assessing material, labour and equipment required, analyzing quotes from sub-contractors and suppliers as well as supporting competitive tender packages, while ensuring that the contract can be carried out profitably, is key.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Develop complete estimates on selected projects consisting of project site visit, quantity take-off, pricing, and presentation of the estimate for cost engineering and management review
  • Assemble estimates from various sources into a complete and final estimate for the company with Engineering support as required
  • Review and validate outsourced estimates with support from engineering
  • Review and incorporate historical data from estimates received, contracts awarded by the EPC Contractor and final actual project costs into Valard’s cost model
  • Format estimates in Owners Reporting format.
  • Review and understand Design Basis, Engineering Design Documents, and Basis of Estimate
  • Prepare written deliverables for bid submission (i.e. understanding of work, assumptions, execution plans)
  • Provide estimating input on complex “conceptual” projects
  • Provide guidance for non-estimating personnel on their estimating related requirements
  • Attend and assist in project planning sessions and team meetings to provide estimating input
  • Interface and communicate effectively (written and oral) with the estimating team, with all levels of management, clients and industry contacts
  • Develop relationships with subcontractors and suppliers for pricing within estimates
  • Develop or assist in the development of general and project specific plans for execution, sequencing, and logistics (including, when required, construction and work procedures for specific activities related to a bid)
  • Develop or assist in the development of preliminary project schedules

Requirements

  • Post-Secondary education in Electrical Engineering, Journeyman Electrician or other related education
  • 10 years of utility construction industry experience with demonstrated estimating exposure or 5 years industry specific estimating experience
  • 3+ years’ estimating experience in projects ranging from $1M to $50M
  • Experience in EPC estimating / execution and preparing written deliverables for bid submissions
  • Demonstrated experience with InEight Estimating Software
  • Technical knowledge of estimating practices, techniques and equipment, including indirect and conceptual estimating techniques and theories
  • Knowledge of construction costs and budgets, ability to develop a project schedule
  • Ability to read drawings and specifications
  • Understanding of construction documents and the ability to assess the level of completeness

Job Posting End Date: January 4th, 2026

Benefits

We offer a comprehensive and competitive total rewards package that incorporates a complete range of employee benefits, including an RRSP matching program, to ensure you have the tools necessary to manage, maintain, and improve your health and wellbeing.

About our Business

Valard Construction is Canada’s premier utility contractor providing comprehensive EPC+ (engineering, procurement, construction) and maintenance services to utilities, independent power producers, mining, oil and gas industries and rural electric associations. We have the capabilities, knowledge, and resources to take on any project, any size, any complexity, anywhere. We are also part of Quanta Services, the largest electrical power contractor in North America.

Valard Construction is an equal opportunity employer.

Learn more

Visit us at www.valard.com and connect with us on our social media channels for our latest news, employee stories, community activities, and other updates.

* Depending on qualifications, the successful candidate may be offered a position at a more appropriate level.

* Applicants must have legal authorization to work in Canada with no restrictions.

* Valard Construction is committed to providing employment opportunities to all qualified individuals, without regard to race, religion, age, sex, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, or disability. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process.

raw.description:
Job Title: Virtual Reporting Assistant

Location: Remote

Job Type: Part Time (2-3 days a week)

Reports To: Head of Operations
Salary: $500 - $1000

About LaunchLaunch With Us stands at the forefront of eCommerce growth, partnering with ambitious DTC brands to achieve profitable scale through data-driven creative strategy, precision media buying, and rigorous performance optimisation.

We've orchestrated over £10M+ in profitable ad spend across Meta, TikTok, and Google for category-defining brands including Khanum's, Lucy & Lola, DJK, Bubble Panda, and Watermans. Our competitive advantage lies in our systematic approach to creative development. We don't rely on intuition or hope. We engineer winning creative through structured experimentation, profound customer insight, and relentless optimisation.

About the RoleWe’re looking for a highly organised, detail-oriented Virtual Reporting Assistant to support our account management team by producing accurate, professional weekly and monthly performance reports for our clients.

This role is process-driven and ideal for someone who enjoys working to clear SOPs, managing multiple clients, and delivering consistently high-quality outputs on tight timelines.

Requirements

  • Strong attention to detail and ability to follow SOPs precisely
  • Confident using Google Slides, Google Sheets, and Google Drive
  • Comfortable handling screenshots, formatting decks, and organising folders
  • Excellent time management and ability to meet fixed deadlines
  • Clear written communication skills (Slack and internal tools)
  • Ability to work independently and manage repetitive, process-based tasks

Nice to Have

  • Experience working with performance marketing or ad reporting
  • Familiarity with Meta Ads, TikTok Ads, or Google Ads reporting
  • Previous experience in a virtual assistant or operations role

Responsibilities
Weekly Client Reporting:

  • Produce weekly & monthly performance reports for multiple clients every Monday, starting at 7am GMT/BST, with completion targeted by 10am–1pm
  • Follow a defined reporting process using internal boards to identify clients and assignees
  • Create and correctly name Google Slides reports using provided templates
  • Pull and screenshot performance data from reporting spreadsheets, filtered to the correct date range
  • Customise reports based on each client’s active advertising platforms (Meta, TikTok, Google)
  • Ensure all reports are professionally formatted, clearly presented, and free of internal instructions
  • Save reports into the correct client folder structure within Google Drive
  • Set appropriate sharing permissions and log report links in internal tracking boards
  • Send completed report links to the relevant account managers via Slack

Monthly Client Reporting:

  • Create monthly performance reports using dedicated monthly templates
  • Screenshot and include both soft metrics and conversion metrics from reporting spreadsheets
  • Adjust reports to reflect the platforms each client uses
  • Maintain consistent formatting, correct section numbering, and clean presentation
  • Upload reports to the correct client folders and update internal boards with links
  • Share completed reports with account managers via Slack

Ongoing Support:

  • Respond to edit requests and feedback from account managers
  • Maintain accuracy, consistency, and attention to detail across all reporting
  • Help improve efficiency and clarity within reporting workflows over time

Benefits

  • You will be part of a world-class team made up of high-performing individuals.
  • You will gain deep insight into how high-growth brands scale using creative strategy and paid social.

title: Head of Client Finance
description: Job Title: Head of Client Finance Job Summary: The Head of Client Finance leads Community Boost’s financial strategy across client accounts, ensuring accuracy, accountability, and profitability in a fast‑paced digital advertising environment serving nonprofit organizations.

raw.title: Head of Client Finance
raw.excerpt: Job Title: Head of Client Finance Job Summary: The Head of Client Finance leads Community Boost’s financial strategy across client accounts, ensuring accuracy, accountability, and profitability in a fast‑paced digital advertising environment serving nonprofit organizations.
raw.description:
Job Title: Head of Client Finance
Job Summary: The Head of Client Finance leads Community Boost’s financial strategy across client accounts, ensuring accuracy, accountability, and profitability in a fast‑paced digital advertising environment serving nonprofit organizations. This role oversees Accounts Receivable and Accounts Payable, partners closely with Accounting and HR systems to understand labor costs, and provides financial insights that guide staffing, pricing, and operational decisions. The ideal candidate brings deep experience from a large or global agency, with the ability to translate complex financial data into clear, actionable recommendations for leadership and client‑facing teams.

Essential Responsibilities

  • Lead financial strategy for client accounts, ensuring healthy margins, accurate forecasting, and alignment with agency revenue goals.
  • Oversee AR and AP processes, ensuring timely invoicing, collections, vendor payments, and financial accuracy across all client engagements.
  • Partner with Accounting to reconcile revenue, expenses, and month‑end close activities.
  • Collaborate with HR and workforce management tools to analyze labor costs, utilization, capacity, and staffing models.
  • Build and maintain financial dashboards, reporting frameworks, and forecasting models that support executive decision‑making.
  • Provide financial guidance to SAMs, PLs, department heads, and other leaders on pricing, scopes, burn rates, and profitability.
  • Monitor client budgets, pacing, and contract compliance to prevent over‑delivery and protect margins.
  • Lead annual budgeting, quarterly reforecasting, QBR financial preparation, and end‑of‑year closing processes in partnership with leadership.
  • Develop and refine financial policies, controls, and workflows that support operational excellence.
  • Serve as the primary point of contact for financial audits, compliance reviews, and external accounting partners.
  • Identify financial risks and opportunities, proactively recommending solutions to improve efficiency and profitability.
  • Train internal teams on financial literacy, budget management, and best practices for scope discipline.

Minimum Qualifications

  • 8–10+ years of finance experience within a large or global advertising, media, or digital agency. Proven track record managing AR/AP, forecasting, and financial operations in a fast‑paced environment.
  • Strong understanding of agency labor models, utilization, billable vs. non‑billable structures, and staffing allocations.
  • Experience working with accounting and HRIS systems such as QuickBooks, NetSuite, Deltek, BambooHR, Gusto, or similar.
  • Advanced proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets, financial modeling, and data visualization tools.
  • Demonstrated ability to partner with cross‑functional teams and influence decision‑making.
  • Exceptional attention to detail, accuracy, and process discipline.
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to translate financial data into clear insights for non‑finance stakeholders.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, or related field; MBA or CPA preferred.

Core Competencies:

Strategic financial leadership: Ability to guide long‑term financial planning, anticipate risks, and shape decisions that protect margins, support growth, and strengthen the agency’s financial health.
Operational excellence: Builds and maintains efficient systems, processes, and controls that ensure accuracy, consistency, and scalability across all financial operations.
Analytical rigor: Applies deep quantitative analysis, financial modeling, and data interpretation to surface insights, identify trends, and drive sound decision‑making.
Agency acumen: Understands agency economics, pricing structures, scopes, utilization, and client profitability, and uses that knowledge to influence operational and financial outcomes.
Cross‑functional collaboration: Works seamlessly with Accounting, HR, SAMs, PLs, and leadership to align financial strategy with staffing, delivery, and organizational priorities.
Communication and influence: Translates complex financial information into clear, actionable guidance and effectively influences stakeholders at all levels to drive alignment and accountability.
Problem‑solving: Approaches challenges with structure and creativity, quickly diagnosing issues and developing solutions that balance financial discipline with operational realities.
Integrity and accountability: Maintains the highest standards of accuracy, confidentiality, and ethical judgment, taking ownership of outcomes and ensuring financial decisions are transparent and sound.

Work Environment:

  • This is a fully remote role; work is performed in a home office setting.
  • Regular virtual interaction with employees, leadership, and external vendors.
  • May occasionally require flexible scheduling to accommodate time zone differences.

raw.excerpt: Req ID:322453 NTT DATA strives to hire exceptional, innovative and passionate individuals who want to grow with us.
raw.description:
Req ID:322453

NTT DATA strives to hire exceptional, innovative and passionate individuals who want to grow with us. If you want to be part of an inclusive, adaptable, and forward-thinking organization, apply now.

We are currently seeking an Application ServicesSpecialty Solution Sellerwho will be responsible for helping us expand our presence in the North American Market.

The Application Services Specialty Solution Seller will drive the growth of Custom Application offerings and provide subject matter expertise within the Banking & Financial Services industry. This critical role identifies and researches potential clients, engages with prospects, describes our services and closes sales.  An Application Services Specialty Seller leverages their deep industry knowledge and expertise to understand customer needs and apply consultative selling techniques to lead the definition of solutions and proposals.  Our approach is highly collaborative and often requires our Application Services Specialty Seller to orchestrate and execute across an array of client and internal personnel, building deep and lasting relationships along the way.

 

This role will work remotely from your home office located within the US with travel required to meet with clients as necessary.

Job Responsibilities Include:

  • Providing technical sales expertise for the development and implementation of complex digital products / applications / solutions
  • Sales, Deal Strategy, Solution development, and Digital Transformation
  • Leverage deep industry knowledge to build relationships, understand customer needs and provide tailored solutions that drive revenue and customer success
  • Engage with prospects and existing clients through consultative selling techniques to uncover pain points and business needs, guiding them to the best possible solutions that align with their objectives
  • Work closely with the solution team and practice experts to develop customized solutions that address client-specific challenges
  • Define the client value and relevance of solution for client using industry relevant KPIs
  • Develop and maintain a deep understanding of industry trends, challenges and opportunities to provide insightful guidance and strategic advice on the industry for technology, product and business clients
  • Build and maintain lasting relationships with clients and partners by understanding focus and needs, and anticipating them in advance 
  • Assisting in assessing potential application of company digital products to meet client needs and may prepare detailed digital product specifications for the development and implementation of client products / applications / solutions
  • Supporting NTT DATA’s client/enterprise product sales efforts through consultative selling activities

Basic Qualifications:

  • Minimum of 8 years’ experience in consulting or IT services industry sales
  • Minimum of 8 years’ experience negotiating, shaping, and closing large deals in the professional services space
  • Minimum of 5 years’ experience selling Custom Application Development, Application Architecture, Cloud Migration & Legacy Modernization services/solutions
  • Minimum of 10 years of cross-industry experience with several of those years focused on the Banking & Financial Services Industry

Preferred Skills:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent (minimum 12 years) work experience
  • Proven experience leading large, complex, strategic sales opportunities
  • Ability to engage and build relations with senior leadership at Fortune 500 organizations
  • Excellent leadership skills, with the ability to oversee and inspire multiple teams, fostering a collaborative and high-performance work environment
  • Attributes include strategic thinking, teamwork, ability to influence, strong analytical and problem-solving skills, a high level of professionalism and strong attention to detail 
  • Must have an expanded breadth of business experience driving deal shaping & origination
  • Ability to interact with senior leadership at a client and/or within NTT DATA
  • Excellent communication (oral & written)

About NTT DATA

NTT DATA is a $30 billion trusted global innovator of business and technology services. We serve 75% of the Fortune Global 100 and are committed to helping clients innovate, optimize and transform for long term success. As a Global Top Employer, we have diverse experts in more than 50 countries and a robust partner ecosystem of established and start-up companies. Our services include business and technology consulting, data and artificial intelligence, industry solutions, as well as the development, implementation and management of applications, infrastructure and connectivity. We are one of the leading providers of digital and AI infrastructure in the world. NTT DATA is a part of NTT Group, which invests over $3.6 billion each year in R&D to help organizations and society move confidently and sustainably into the digital future. Visit us at us.nttdata.com

NTT DATA endeavors to make https://us.nttdata.com accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact us at https://us.nttdata.com/en/contact-us. This contact information is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications. NTT DATA is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. For our EEO Policy Statement, please click here. If you'd like more information on your EEO rights under the law, please click here. For Pay Transparency information, please click here.

Where required by law, NTT DATA provides a reasonable range of compensation for specific roles. The starting pay range for this remote role is $168,112 - 280,188. This range reflects the minimum and maximum target compensation for the position across all US locations. Actual compensation will depend on a number of factors, including the candidate’s actual work location, relevant experience, technical skills, and other qualifications. This position may also be eligible for incentive compensation based on individual and/or company performance.

This position is eligible for company benefits including medical, dental, and vision insurance with an employer contribution, flexible spending or health savings account, life and AD&D insurance, short and long term disability coverage, paid time off, employee assistance, participation in a 401k program with company match, and additional voluntary or legally-required benefits.

raw.excerpt: Construction Manager | Ripple FiberWe are looking for a Construction Manager to join our growing team in Columbus, OH.
raw.description:
Construction Manager | Ripple Fiber

We are looking for a Construction Manager to join our growing team in Columbus, OH.

About Ripple Fiber

At Ripple Fiber, we deliver more than high-speed internet. We’re creating a ripple effect by producing opportunities and brighter futures for the residents of the communities we serve. Join America’s most innovative, industry-leading fiber internet company, and help shape the future.

We believe the biggest wave starts as a ripple.

About our culture

We are a dynamic, fast-growing, and innovative company driven by ambitious self-starters with entrepreneurial mindsets. Our fast-paced environment fosters creativity, collaboration, and initiative. We are people-centric, placing strong emphasis on employee experience, career growth, and professional development.

About the role

The Construction Manager is responsible for overseeing the planning, execution, and completion of construction projects related to our fiber optic network infrastructure. Your primary goal will be to ensure projects are delivered on time, within budget, and meet the high-quality standards expected in the telecommunications industry.

Responsibilities:

  • Oversees construction sites, general contractors, and workers to ensure a high level of quality and safety.
  • Guarantees that all work is performed in accordance with approved manuals and procedures.
  • Provides technical support to Project Managers.
  • Develops and maintains project cost/change controls, and project budget and accounting records.
  • Performs change order estimating and assists the Project Manager in change order negotiations.
  • Assists in managing and reviewing the progress of contractors’ construction schedules.
  • Reports the status of projects to business and market leaders.
  • Attend client program meetings as needed.
  • Reviews weekly and monthly reports on the status and progress of the contracts, including project costs and potential changes.
  • Coordinates and monitors schedule updates, invoices, and submittals.
  • Responsible for daily management of Construction Technicians including scheduling and training.
  • Develop and implement procedures to better organize the team/department.
  • Ensures that the project is constructed and documented in accordance with the contract documents and good engineering practices.
  • Allocation of projects to general contractors based on scheduling needs and availability.

Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of experience in fiber-optic or telecom construction.
  • Strong understanding of fiber installation methods: aerial, underground, and splicing.
  • Familiarity with fiber troubleshooting.
  • Proven experience managing subcontractors and field crews.
  • Working knowledge of permitting processes and utility coordination.
  • Excellent communication, organization, and leadership skills.
  • Valid driver’s license; ability to travel to job sites regularly.
  • High school diploma or equivalent required.

We offer competitive pay, comprehensive health benefits, 401(k) with company match, and a supportive work environment where innovation and teamwork thrive. If you’re passionate about making a difference and being part of a community-focused company, Ripple Fiber is the place for you.

Ripple Fiber is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that no one should be discriminated against because of their differences, such as age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, religion, or sexual orientation. All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law. Ripple Fiber is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.

Salary: $75,000-$90,000 BOE

raw.excerpt: Cloud Architect and Infrastructure Lead (CAIL)OCT Consulting is a business management and technology consulting firm that supports Federal Government clients.
raw.description:
Cloud Architect and Infrastructure Lead (CAIL)

OCT Consulting is a business management and technology consulting firm that supports Federal Government clients. We provide consulting services in the areas of Strategy, Process Improvement, Change Management, Program and Project Management, Acquisition/Procurement, and Information Technology.

Responsibilities and Duties

OCT currently has an opening for a Cloud Architect and Infrastructure Lead (CAIL) to work with our federal client. The CAIL will be the lead designer and manager of the cloud and data infrastructure that hosts the agency’s digital enterprise. This role will be critical for delivering a high-availability, scalable platform within AWS GovCloud capable of supporting outreach and engagement services and meeting DoD performance requirements.

Day to day responsibilities include:

  • Design, implement, optimize, and manage information systems, applications, networks, and storage solutions within agency’s Amazon Web Services (AWS) GovCloud and digital environments.
  • Provide a high-availability, scalable system architecture, leveraging tools for IT management and proactive cybersecurity measures.
  • Ensure the IT infrastructure supports the primary objective of O&E operations to function properly.
  • Ensure operational excellence of the agency’s IT enterprise in AWS GovCloud.
  • Support 24 hours a day, seven days a week (24/7) operation throughout the year for the IT infrastructure.
  • Utilize Agile development methodologies during all phases for the development of new technology and refresh or enhancements of existing technology.
  • Provide technology solutions that are driven by user-centered design principles.
  • Management of large teams of IT and cybersecurity personnel.

Requirements

● Must be a U.S. Citizen (Required)

  • Active Top Secret Clearance / Favorably Adjudicated Tier 5 Investigation (Required)
  • Must be in the National Capital Region and available to support on-site as required (Preferred)
  • A bachelor’s degree in computer science, IT, information systems, or a related field. (Required)
  • 6+ years of experience of DoD or Federal IT Architecture and / or Infrastructure Experience (Required)
  • 5+ years of experience in AWS GovCloud architecture and infrastructure support (Required)
  • 5+ years of experience supporting cloud architecture and infrastructure in DevSecOps and Agile development environments (Required)
  • Possess one of the following certifications: Certified in Governance, Risk and Compliance (CGRC), Security+, CISM, CISSP, CompTIA Advanced Security Practitioner (CASP+), or Global Information Assurance Security Leadership Certification

Certification (GSLC) (Required)

  • AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Professional (Preferred)
  • Deep understanding of cloud operations and cybersecurity compliance within a DoD environment (e.g., AWS GovCloud, ZTA, NIST RMF) (Preferred)
  • Expert knowledge of DoD CC SRG Impact Levels (IL) 2, 4, and 5. Demonstrated experience with cloud security postures in AWS GovCloud (Preferred)
  • Experience with high-availability and disaster recovery planning for 24/7 operations (Preferred)

Benefits

OCT offers competitive compensation packages and a full suite of benefits which include:

● Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance

  • Retirement savings 401K plan provided by an industry leading provider with 3% employer contributions of the employee’s gross salary
  • Paid Time Off and Standard Government Holidays
  • Life Insurance, Short- and Long-Term disability benefits

● Training Benefits

Salary Range: $150,000- $200,000 yearly commensurate with experience, education, etc.

About OCT Consulting

OCT Consulting LLC is a Small Business (SB) providing professional services and information technology solutions to the Federal government and commercial clients. Founded in 2013, we bring the agility of operations and a management team with a track record of leading successful engagements at major Federal government agencies.

At OCT we believe in creating a work environment where employees can thrive based on their abilities, skills, and achievements. We are dedicated to providing career growth and professional development based on individual merit and fostering a workplace where everyone’s contributions are valued and recognized.

title: Director of Marketing
description: Schema App is a fast-paced, profitable SaaS company headquartered in Guelph, Ontario, and proud of our Canada-wide team.

raw.title: Director of Marketing
raw.excerpt: Schema App is a fast-paced, profitable SaaS company headquartered in Guelph, Ontario, and proud of our Canada-wide team.
raw.description:
Schema App is a fast-paced, profitable SaaS company headquartered in Guelph, Ontario, and proud of our Canada-wide team. We are a smart, collaborative team on a mission to be a global leader in Enterprise Marketing Tech Innovation with a focus on content knowledge graphs. Schema App is proud to call SAP, Wells Fargo, and Henry Ford Health our customers. We are the leaders in a niche area of search engine optimization (SEO), called schema markup. Schema markup builds knowledge graphs that unlock AI and Search understanding of web content. Our comprehensive end-to-end solution empowers Enterprise Digital Marketing Teams to achieve organic search results, content insights and increased AI efficiency. Our technology is essential with the evolution of AI Search (ChatGPT, AI Overviews, and Gemini).

Visit Schema App at www.schemaapp.com or on LinkedIn.

We are seeking amarketing leader to own the marketing function and drive the acquisition of targeted enterprise customers in support of our highly achievable three-year growth goal. This role will play a key part in increasing knowledge of our brand in the U.S. as a leader in marketing technology innovation among our ideal customer profile and will be part of our leadership team.

Functional Accountabilities

  • Enterprise Marketing & Acquisition Strategy and Execution:
    • Define and execute an enterprise acquisition strategy focused on ideal customer profile (ICP) accounts to meet 3 year highly achievable goal.
    • Continuously test and measure new marketing approaches to refine and scale the playbook.
    • Meet or exceed quarterly targets for marketing-sourced, sales-accepted ICP opportunities.
    • Improve acquisition efficiency while scaling pipeline, ensuring marketing spend consistently translates into ICP pipeline coverage and opportunity creation.
  • Brand & Value Messaging:
    • Own Schema App’s brand positioning and value proposition. Partner with Product to translate what the product does into differentiated value for enterprise buyers.
    • Define and maintain a clear messaging framework
    • Validate messaging through measurable impact on ICP MQL quality, sales acceptance, and pipeline performance.
    • Ensure consistent execution of the value proposition across all customer-facing channels, including website, campaigns, sales assets, and executive conversations.
    • Serve as steward of the message by testing, refining, and modeling it, while enabling Sales and Customer Success leaders to ensure consistent delivery.
  • Thought Leadership:
    • Develop and execute a thought leadership strategy that increases Schema App’s credibility, visibility, and influence with enterprise buyers and partners.
    • Serve as a visible voice in the market by representing Schema App at priority conferences, webinars, and industry forums.
    • Build a scalable thought leadership program that drives measurable impact on brand awareness, partnerships, and pipeline, with primary focus on the US market
  • Customer Events and Advisory Board:
    • Lead customer and prospect events that drive engagement, expansion, and new pipeline opportunities.
    • Partner with the Head of Customer Success to design and run a Customer Advisory Board that provides clear, actionable customer insights to the leadership team and reinforces Schema App’s vision and strategy with key buyers.
  • Team Leadership & Coaching:
    • Build, lead, and sustain an A-player marketing team that consistently delivers company goals.
    • Hire, develop, and coach team members to A-player performance standards, using clearly defined role scorecards with outcomes, competencies, and success metrics.
    • Conduct quarterly talent reviews for all direct reports. Actively upgrade talent by coaching B-players with clear expectations and time-bound improvement plans, and exiting C-players in a timely manner.
    • Define, maintain, and regularly update A-player scorecards that clearly outline outcomes, competencies, and success metrics for each role.
    • Model and reinforce Schema App’s values, holding team members accountable for both results and behaviors.
  • Leadership Team Member:
    • Act as an effective and accountable member of the leadership team, contributing to company-wide strategy, prioritization, and execution.
    • Adopt and operate within the Metronomics framework, coming prepared to leadership meetings with clear data, perspectives, and recommendations.
    • Engage in constructive debate to surface the best decisions, then fully own and execute agreed-upon priorities, regardless of prior disagreement.
    • Partner cross-functionally to achieve company goals and the 3HAG, holding peers accountable for both results and adherence to Schema App’s values.

Key Competencies

  • Strategic Leadership
    Identifies and prioritizes the highest-impact opportunities within Marketing and across the business. Balances short-term execution with long-term strategy and makes clear trade-offs that consider customer needs, company goals, and functional constraints.
  • People Leadership & Talent Management
    Builds and sustains high-performing teams aligned to Schema App’s values. Coaches for accountability, ownership, and continuous improvement. Holds team members to clear scorecards and makes timely talent decisions, including upgrading or exiting when performance or values fall short.
  • Executive Communication & Influence
    Communicates clearly and persuasively with internal and external stakeholders. Crafts strong marketing narratives and adapts messaging to executives, customers, analysts, and partners. Influences decisions through clarity, evidence, and credibility.
  • SaaS & Enterprise Market Acumen
    Understands enterprise SaaS buying as relationship-driven, involving multiple stakeholders and long decision cycles. Communicates value in terms of long-term outcomes, retention, and expansion rather than transactional wins. Accurately positions Schema App’s product-led model by reflecting the combined value of technology and services as a unified customer experience.
  • Customer & Market Engagement
    Demonstrates experience leading customer-facing initiatives, including enterprise events and executive-level engagement. Effectively represents Schema App with senior buyers, customers, and market influencers.
  • Operational Discipline & Efficiency
    Continuously improves how work gets done. Experiments, learns, and applies insights to increase efficiency and impact. Drives disciplined execution in a fast-moving, scaling environment.
  • Learning & Adaptability
    Demonstrates a strong bias toward action and execution. Defines and runs quarterly disciplined experiments aligned to company priorities, each with clear hypotheses, success metrics, and timelines. Applies insights from wins and failures to improve personal effectiveness, team performance, and marketing impact.

Metrics

  • # of marketing-sourced, sales-accepted ICP opportunities (enterprise)
  • ≥75% of marketing-sourced enterprise opportunities from named target accounts
  • Cost of Customer Acquisition target X, with improvement 10% Q/Q.
  • Thought Leadership Reach & Influence (multiple voices active, media mentions, speaking engagements, share of voice).
  • >80% A-players within your function, as assessed through quarterly talent reviews and discussed with leadership team.

Core Values Alignment

  • Growth Mindset – Continuously experiments, learns, and adapts in enterprise and AI-driven marketing.
  • Resourceful – Delivers high-impact results creatively with strong ROI.
  • One Team – Collaborates seamlessly across Sales, CS, Product, and partners
  • We are Humble – Elevates team and partner voices, seeks feedback, and adapts with curiosity.

This role is remote within Canada, with a strong preference for candidates located within commuting distance of our Guelph office. Our leadership team meets quarterly, so occasional travel is required.

Life @ Schema App

  • Culture focused on your growth: Weekly 1:1 with conversations around Professional Development
  • Great benefits for health & wellness, and your coverage starts as soon as you do
  • RRSP matching!
  • Flex days to re-energize on top of vacation days and you don’t work on your birthday
  • You choose where you work - home or headquarters in Guelph. The sales team comes into the office 1–2 times per week
  • The Culture Club keeps our virtual team connected through fun and innovative events
  • Diverse smart team! The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be
  • Schema App’s purpose is to build meaningful connections, with each other, our customers, and the data so that we are all understood. We are a team of smart people helping each other solve hard problems.
Salary: $145,000 - $170,000 DOE

title: Home Infusion RN - Independent Contractor (Covina, CA)
description: About AmeriPharmaAmeriPharma is a rapidly growing healthcare company where you will have the opportunity to contribute to our joint success on a daily basis.

raw.title: Home Infusion RN - Independent Contractor (Covina, CA)
raw.excerpt: About AmeriPharmaAmeriPharma is a rapidly growing healthcare company where you will have the opportunity to contribute to our joint success on a daily basis.
raw.description:
About AmeriPharma

AmeriPharma is a rapidly growing healthcare company where you will have the opportunity to contribute to our joint success on a daily basis. We value new ideas, creativity, and productivity. We like people who are passionate about their roles and people who like to grow and change as the company evolves.

Job Summary

AmeriPharma is seeking a dedicated Registered Nurse (RN) with expertise in home infusion therapy to join our team. This role combines infusion therapy and patient education, providing both in-home care and valuable support to patients undergoing treatments such as TPN, IVIG, and IV biologics.

The RN will be responsible for providing telephone and in-person advice and education to patients. This role requires offering interventions, counseling, and support services that require significant nursing knowledge, judgment, and skills in psychological, biological, physical, and social sciences. Under the supervision of the Director of Nursing, the RN will make decisions based on their education, nursing experience, and clinical guidelines, ensuring optimal compliance and persistence in home infusion programs.

Schedule Details & Locations

  • Per Diem, Flexible Hours
  • Independent Contractor

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Conduct in-home infusion therapy visits with patients according to the plan of care.
  • Prepare clinical/nursing notes and document patient interventions in both clinical and non-clinical records consistently.
  • Act as a clinical resource, working collaboratively with other pharmacy departments.
  • Maintain knowledge of drug side effects and interactions.
  • Offer telephone and in-person patient education on therapy protocols, drug side effects, and home infusion procedures.
  • Ensure patients understand their therapy plans, medications, and the importance of adherence.
  • During initial and ongoing consultations, serve as a patient liaison between the patient, their family, and the pharmacy to ensure a seamless therapy process.
  • Perform comprehensive, initial, and periodic head-to-toe assessments for patients and initiate preventative and rehabilitative care.
  • Use health assessment data, and input from the agency team, the physician, the patient, and the family to determine patient needs.
  • Manage patient and family expectations regarding services, outcomes, and discharge goals.
  • Establish primary and secondary diagnoses based on patient assessment and home health care focus.
  • Develop care plans with skilled interventions, medical supplies, and necessary services to meet goals.
  • Regularly evaluate patient progress, in collaboration with team members, and revise care plans as needed.
  • Perform other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

  • Graduate of an accredited nursing school with a current RN state license.
  • 5+ years of experience in home infusion and infusion centers.
  • 3+ Experience with IV Immunoglobulins and IV Biologics. CRNI certification(Certified Registered Nurse Infusion) is preferred.
  • Experience with peripheral IV starts, infusion therapy, and phlebotomy for both adult and pediatric patients is preferred
  • Effective interpersonal, time management, and organizational skills.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Organizational ability to maintain consistently accurate records.
  • Ability to direct information to the appropriate healthcare provider.
  • Proficient in computer skills, including word processing, and efficient use of the internet and email.
  • Current CPR and BLS (Red Cross and AHA) certification, valid driver’s license, reliable transportation, and automobile insurance.

AmeriPharma’s Mission Statement

Our goal is to achieve superior clinical and economic outcomes while maintaining the utmost compassion and care for our patients. It is our joint and individual responsibility daily to demonstrate to outpatients, prescribers, colleagues, and others that We Care!

Salary: $60 - $65 Hourly, DOE

raw.description:
Anywhere Talent: Join Our Team as a Video Editor

About Us

Anywhere Talent is redefining how businesses connect with global talent. Founded in 2015 by brothers Aamir and Asif, our company was built on a vision to harness the potential of remote work. Today, we specialize in connecting businesses with skilled talent worldwide, leveraging cutting-edge AI tools to streamline workflows and customize training. Our approach combines advanced technology with a human touch, enabling teams to focus on impactful work while reducing inefficiencies. At Anywhere Talent, we don’t just connect businesses with talent—we build partnerships that drive success.

What You Will Do:

  • Create and repurpose engaging video content for daily needs, including interviews, tutorials, ads, and blog posts.
  • Resize and format videos for various social media platforms to ensure maximum engagement.
  • Develop visually stunning content, such as timelapses, reels, GIFs, animations, and more.
  • Utilize stock footage, hooks, and editing techniques to craft compelling visuals and select the best shots for videos.
  • Collaborate with team members to maintain consistent visual standards across all marketing materials.
  • Meet deadlines while contributing to team goals and projects.
  • This list is just a summary and does not contain all the responsibilities.

Who You Are:

  • A creative professional proficient in design tools such as Photoshop, Illustrator, Adobe Suite, Figma, and Miro.
  • Skilled in Adobe Premiere Pro and Adobe Lightroom, with a working knowledge of Adobe Creative Cloud: InDesign.
  • Experience with UI/UX design is a plus, as well as familiarity with Adobe XD.
  • A great communicator with excellent verbal and written skills, able to communicate clearly and positively via phone, email, and in person.
  • Highly organized, thriving in a fast-paced environment and capable of managing multiple projects simultaneously.
  • A team player who brings fresh ideas and consistently produces high-quality work.

What Do We Offer?

  • Job Type: Full-time
  • Salary: TBD at offer
  • Schedule: 8-hour shifts, Monday to Friday, with night shift availability required.
  • Experience: 6 months to 1 year of experience in video editing and Photoshop/content creation. A degree, diploma, or certifications in relevant fields will be preferred.

Must Have:

  • A computer with a webcam and a smartphone.
  • A reliable internet connection.
  • A strong portfolio showcasing your video editing and design skills.

Anywhere Talent is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status.

Join Anywhere Talent and become a key player in connecting businesses with global talent while enjoying the flexibility of remote work. Let’s create partnerships that drive success together!

Apply now and embark on a rewarding journey with us!

title: Digital Solutions Sales Manager (Remote, US)
description: The Agfa-Gevaert Group develops, produces and distributes an extensive range of imaging systems and IT solutions, mainly for the printing industry and the healthcare sector, as well as for specific industrial applications.

raw.title: Digital Solutions Sales Manager (Remote, US)
raw.excerpt: The Agfa-Gevaert Group develops, produces and distributes an extensive range of imaging systems and IT solutions, mainly for the printing industry and the healthcare sector, as well as for specific industrial applications.
raw.description:
The Agfa-Gevaert Group develops, produces and distributes an extensive range of imaging systems and IT solutions, mainly for the printing industry and the healthcare sector, as well as for specific industrial applications.

Agfa Inkjet Solutions, a division of the Agfa-Gevaert Group, specializes in innovative inkjet printing technologies for a wide range of industries, including commercial printing, packaging, textiles, and industrial applications. The company offers high-quality digital printing systems, including hardware, ink, printheads, and software, designed to deliver precise, vibrant results across various materials. Agfa emphasizes sustainability with eco-friendly ink formulations and efficient, cost-effective solutions. With a strong focus on research and development, Agfa Inkjet Solutions continues to lead in advancing printing technology, providing businesses globally with cutting-edge, environmentally conscious printing systems.

We are looking for a Digital Solutions Sales Manager to join our Graphics Sales Team. You will be responsible for achieving the budgeted sales plan for digital imaging sales in your territory.

Location:

  • Remote - California

What You'll Do:

  • Achieve established sales quota in assigned territory through effective promotion of Digital Imaging portfolio.
  • Use the resources within the digital imaging group and outside manufacturer representatives to drive the business in the assigned geographic area.
  • Develop and maintain relationships with existing customers.
  • Work with the sales representatives in the territory to develop new account opportunities for digital imaging products. (hunting)
  • Ensure that we are moving each opportunity, effectively through the sales cycle including proposal development, handling objections, and closing.
  • Work with service organization to ensure customer satisfaction with our digital imaging accounts.
  • Maintain full responsibility for an accurate forecast on Microsoft Dynamics and other systems.
  • Prepare presentations and be technically proficient with the Agfa full line of digital printing equipment.
  • Keep sales management advised of the competitive landscape.
  • Manage an expense budget.

Who You Are:

  • Bachelor’s degree
  • Experience selling high end capital equipment in the graphic arts industry.
  • Core competency of technical and business skills necessary to close sales of high-end graphic arts equipment.
  • Ability to work independently.
  • Self-motivated and commitment to customers
  • Critical attention to detail
  • Knowledge of assigned geography
  • Highly computer literate (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SalesLink)
  • Highly proficient in negotiation and communication skills within all levels of an organization.

(Agfa) Our Values:

Own It (I do what I say, full accountability for results, finding solutions and Practice ethical and safe behaviors)

Play as One (Collaborate for a common goal, diverse perspectives. Listen and communicate with respect, support decision for teams’ benefits)

Move Forward (Embrace change, explore opportunities to innovate, feedback and improve performance, Proactive steps to resolve issues and continuous progress).

Drive Value (Bold choices to maximize value creation, customer deliver exceptional value, add value to all stakeholders, use data to generate crucial insights and outcomes).

What we offer now and in the future:

  • Dynamic global organization with a history of innovation and strong product portfolio.
  • Challenging environment combined with a supportive management structure.
  • Career development and growth.
  • Competitive salary and benefit package.
  • Friendly work environment surrounded by dedicated and professional colleagues.

Diversity and Inclusion:

At Agfa, our mission at Agfa is to ensure that everyone belongs. We believe that diversity and inclusion of others promotes a greater feeling of belonging and higher levels of engagement. We know that if we work together, we can do amazing things, and that our differences are what make our company, products, and services great.

title: Senior Key Account Manager*in (m/w/d)
description: wen wir suchenLET’S SELL WITH IMPACT!  Du willst nicht auf der Stelle treten, sondern in einer dynamischen, schnell wachsenden Branche Verantwortung übernehmen?

raw.title: Senior Key Account Manager*in (m/w/d)
raw.excerpt: wen wir suchenLET’S SELL WITH IMPACT!  Du willst nicht auf der Stelle treten, sondern in einer dynamischen, schnell wachsenden Branche Verantwortung übernehmen?
raw.description:
wen wir suchen

LET’S SELL WITH IMPACT!

Du willst nicht auf der Stelle treten, sondern in einer dynamischen, schnell wachsenden Branche Verantwortung übernehmen? Du brennst für den Vertrieb, liebst den direkten Kundenkontakt am Telefon und willst in einem High-Performance-Team zeigen, was du draufhast? Dann bist du bei uns genau richtig!

Als SeniorKey Account Manager*in (m/w/d) in der Medizinal-Cannabis-Branche übernimmst du ein bestehendes Apotheken-Portfolio und entwickelst es gezielt weiter. Du wirst Teil eines leistungsstarken Vertriebsteams, das mit Leidenschaft, Tempo und klarer Abschlussorientierung arbeitet.

Remote, effizient und mit echtem Drive!

das packst du an

Verantwortung übernehmen: Du betreust eigenständig Apotheken im B2B-Umfeld, entwickelst dein Kundenportfolio weiter und baust nachhaltige Beziehungen auf.

Aktiver Verkauf: Das Telefon ist dein wichtigstes Tool – über 90 % unseres Geschäfts läuft remote. Du erkennst Potenziale, platzierst unsere Produkte und bringst Abschlüsse sicher über die Ziellinie.

Schnelligkeit & Tiefe: Du verstehst schnell, was Kund*innen brauchen, gehst souverän auf Einwände ein und findest lösungsorientierte Antworten – immer mit dem Ziel, Umsatz zu generieren.

Strategisches Vorgehen: Du entwickelst deine Accounts durch gezielte Maßnahmen weiter und erkennst, wann persönliche Besuche oder Sonderaktionen sinnvoll sind.

Datengetriebene Steuerung: Mit Salesforce und Power BI steuerst du deinen Vertrieb datenbasiert und dokumentierst alle Aktivitäten nachvollziehbar und strukturiert.

für dauerhaften erfolg bringst du mit

Erfahrung im Vertrieb: Du hast mindestens 3-5 Jahre Erfahrung im aktiven Verkauf – idealerweise im Pharma-, Life-Science-, Großhandels- oder Apothekenumfeld.

Sales-Mindset: Abschlussorientierung, Eigenverantwortung, Tempo – du willst erfolgreich sein und bringst den Antrieb von selbst mit.

Kommunikationsstärke: Du überzeugst am Telefon, baust schnell Vertrauen auf und kommunizierst sicher auf Augenhöhe – auch mit Entscheider:innen.

CRM-Affinität: Salesforce ist dir vertraut. Du arbeitest strukturiert, präzise und nutzt Tools zur gezielten Vertriebssteuerung.

Drive & Gestaltungswille: Du willst Verantwortung übernehmen, wachsen und gestalten. Unsere Branche ist jung – und du bist es im Kopf.

was wir bieten

WARUM CANSATIVA? Wir sind nicht nur Marktführer – wir gestalten den Markt. Unser Team ist ambitioniert, energiegeladen und bereit, die nächste Stufe zu zünden. Wenn du bereit bist, mit uns zu skalieren und ein Marketing-Ökosystem aufzubauen, das Maßstäbe setzt, dann komm an Bord!

DEINE BENEFITS

  • Du profitierst von einem attraktiven Gehaltspaket mit Fixum und variabler Vergütung für Deinen Erfolg.
  • Du erhältst ein Mobilitätspaket, um flexibel und mobil zu bleiben.
  • Du hast die Möglichkeit, die Marketingstrategie eines Marktführers in der Cannabisbranche maßgeblich zu gestalten.
  • Du erhältst 30 Tage Urlaub, denn wir wissen, wie wichtig Erholung für Hochleistung ist.
  • Bleib mobil und gesund mit deinem Wunschrad über JobRad – auch zur privaten Nutzung.
  • Jeden Monat bekommst du 70€ über Lofino für deine persönlichen Extras.
  • Du genießt exklusive Corporate Benefits mit Sparvorteilen bei Top-Marken.
  • Wir bieten Dir eine betriebliche Altersvorsorge, denn Deine Zukunft ist uns wichtig.
  • Wir unterstützen dein fachliches und persönliches Wachstum mit einem Weiterbildungsbudget.
  • Erlebe Teamgeist bei regelmäßigen Teamevents wie Grillabenden, Sommerfesten und sportlichen Aktivitäten.
  • Wir nehmen Rücksicht auf deine familiären Bedürfnisse und bieten flexible Lösungen.
  • Genieße die Flexibilität des hybriden Arbeitens – zwischen Homeoffice und Büro, ganz nach deinem Bedarf.

title: Lead Engineer (Tech Lead)
description: This is a fully remote position.  Our stack: Ruby on Rails, Postgresql, Heroku, Scout, Bugsnag, Hubspot, Intercom, Slack, Linear, Figma As the tech lead of our small Engineering team, you will be responsible for driving delivery, making & owning technical decisions, fostering collaboration & transparency, building foundational & impactful products, and owning delivery.

raw.title: Lead Engineer (Tech Lead)
raw.excerpt: This is a fully remote position.  Our stack: Ruby on Rails, Postgresql, Heroku, Scout, Bugsnag, Hubspot, Intercom, Slack, Linear, Figma As the tech lead of our small Engineering team, you will be responsible for driving delivery, making & owning technical decisions, fostering collaboration & transparency, building foundational & impactful products, and owning delivery.
raw.description:
This is a fully remote position.

Our stack: Ruby on Rails, Postgresql, Heroku, Scout, Bugsnag, Hubspot, Intercom, Slack, Linear, Figma

As the tech lead of our small Engineering team, you will be responsible for driving delivery, making & owning technical decisions, fostering collaboration & transparency, building foundational & impactful products, and owning delivery.

This is NOT a management position.

This is a hands-on Lead IC role where you will be in the weeds writing technical tickets, making project-based estimates, driving delivery, unblocking the engineers, and collaborating with the CEO & Product Lead on future projects.

You will report directly to the CEO. Our team hierarchy is as follows, and you will be overseeing the Engineering team directly:

  1. CEO
  2. Tech Lead, Customer Success Lead, Product Lead
  3. Engineers

Requirements

  • Reset expectations around experience quality, process, and code—Raise the quality bar
  • Lead the engineering team by providing clear direction and expectations on performance
  • Make and own technical decisions for our core platform
  • Write & break down technical tickets to guide the Engineering team during implementation
  • Review & write code when necessary
  • Collaborate with CEO & Product Lead on future projects
  • Own the delivery timeline (This is shared responsibility between the Tech Lead & Product Lead)
  • Able to operate effectively in a fast-paced environment, while setting your team up for sustainable success
  • Manage engineering team processes in Slack, Github, Linear, etc to be collaborative, transparent, and consistent

Must Have’s

  • Located in the USA or Canada (This role is fully remote)
  • Must maintain core working hours between 10am - 2pm EST
  • A MINIMUM of 8yrs of hands-on Ruby on Rails, Postgresql, and Heroku experience
  • Led or owned production-grade Ruby on Rails applications, spanning deployment, infrastructure, performance, and monitoring
  • Strong communication & collaboration skills
  • Experience at an early startup with less than 20 engineers
  • Experience leading teams, including hiring and holding team members accountable

Benefits

  • 401k with employer match
  • Take as you need it PTO policy with all federal holidays off
  • Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision
  • Please note that benefits are dependent on whether the candidate is located inside the US or outside the US
  • If you are located in Canada, you will be a full-time contractor

Hiring process (4 steps)

  1. Product & Design assessment (1hr)
  2. Take-home (2hr) paid
  3. Technical assessment (1hr)
  4. CEO chat (30min)
  5. Offer

A note from our Founder:

This is a culture-defining role for a 10-year-old company that is back in ‘startup mode’, building a category-defining product. This role is for someone who has a great compass and a high bar for products.

That alone should excite you …

But let me dive a bit deeper. We’re a company that doesn’t look for clever ideas but clear problems. Our founding journey was interviewing hundreds of accounting firm owners to find the pain and build a simple, delightly, impactful product that removes the pain. We like to build, not banter on how things should work… instead we like to get to work :) You’re coming in as we’re nearing the launch of ‘v2’, which is like reaching basecamp at Everest.

We’re ambitious but not reckless. We have no VC’s, no monster ‘fundraising’ round, we hope saves us from becoming profitable. We’ve raised a bit, but never lost control. We want to innovate, have fun, and build with smart, thoughtful, kind people. If that’s you, we’d love to chat.

description: CyberMSI is seeking an exceptionally motivated, highly resilient Sales Development Representative (SDR) to join our growing sales team.

raw.title: Sales Development Representative (SDR) - USA
raw.excerpt: CyberMSI is seeking an exceptionally motivated, highly resilient Sales Development Representative (SDR) to join our growing sales team.
raw.description:
CyberMSI is seeking an exceptionally motivated, highly resilient Sales Development Representative (SDR) to join our growing sales team.

In this role, you’ll be on the front line of sales pipeline creation by developing leads through prospecting into new accounts and qualifying opportunities for the sales team. You’ll use your innate persistence, creativity, and strong communication skills to build trusted relationships from the very first contact and help accelerate CyberMSI’s growth.

Your experience working at MDR (Managed Detection & Response) and/or MSSP (Managed Security Services Provider) companies, preferably selling Microsoft security products and services, will enable you to deliver outstanding sales results in the first 90 days of starting your adventure with CyberMSI.

If you’re an SDR ready for a challenging yet lucrative opportunity that can propel your career to the next level with a fast-growing cybersecurity company, we want to hear from you. Apply today!

What You’ll Do

  • Prospect through cold calling, emailing, and LinkedIn outreach to drive new business.
  • Schedule meetings and meet/exceed your quota for qualified appointments.
  • Leverage HubSpot CRM, ZoomInfo, and LinkedIn to manage and track lead generation.
  • Execute call scripts, email campaigns, and networking strategies to generate and qualify sales leads.
  • Work closely with the VP of sales to deliver engaging, insightful sales presentations.

What You’ll Bring

  • Possessing minimum 2+ years of experience in sales at an MDR or MSSP company.
  • Selling Microsoft’s (Defender XDR, Sentinel SIEM and Purview) or one of its leading competitors’ (CrowdStrike, Rapid7, etc.) managed security services.
  • Executing successful prospecting campaigns for the mid-market (500–2,000 employees).
  • Navigating complex/challenging sales environments with proven sales techniques.
  • Excellent English communication skills—written, verbal, and presentation.
  • Showing high levels of motivation and positive attitude with a marked hunger to succeed.
  • Bachelor’s degree with a GPA of at least 3.0.

What We’ll Offer

  • Market-leading base pay plus uncapped commissions and performance bonuses.
  • Health, vision, and dental insurance coverage.
  • 401(k) with employer match.
  • Remote work with no hybrid requirements.
  • Flexible paid time off (PTO) to recharge and reset.
  • Rapid career progression based on performance milestones, not time in seat.

title: Director of Communications
description: About Hallmark Health Care Solutions, Inc At Hallmark Health Care Solutions, the two aspects — what we do and how we do it — are tightly interwoven.

raw.title: Director of Communications
raw.excerpt: About Hallmark Health Care Solutions, Inc At Hallmark Health Care Solutions, the two aspects — what we do and how we do it — are tightly interwoven.
raw.description:
About Hallmark Health Care Solutions, Inc

At Hallmark Health Care Solutions, the two aspects — what we do and how we do it — are tightly interwoven. In our products and our people alike, we put a relentless focus on truth, trust, transparency, respect and service.

Hallmark Health Care Solutions is led by passionate experts with an average of 20+ years’ experience in IT, nursing, process engineering, finance, and healthcare. We are committed to strengthening communities by producing technologies, support services, and thought leadership that tangibly improve patient care and community health outcomes.

We are seeking a Director of Communications to play a central role in shaping how our company tells its story as we continue our growth journey and brand evolution. This is a highly visible leadership position for a communications professional who thrives at the intersection of strategy, execution, and storytelling.

The Director of Communications reports to the Vice President of Marketing and will be responsible for developing and delivering clear, compelling narratives across multiple channels while ensuring projects move efficiently from concept through completion. This role requires equal strength in project management and hands-on writing, along with the confidence to work directly with clients and senior executives.

We prioritize candidates who are based in the Dallas area and able to come into the office two or three times a week. That said, we also recognize that top talent can be found nationwide so if the role aligns with your experience, we encourage you to apply no matter where you’re located.

Key Responsibilities

Communications Strategy and Leadership

  • Partner with the VP of Marketing to develop and execute an integrated communications strategy that supports company growth, brand positioning, and business objectives
  • Serve as a trusted communications advisor to company leadership and key stakeholders
  • Ensure consistent messaging across all internal and external communications

Content Development and Thought Leadership

  • Lead the creation of high quality thought leadership content, including blogs, case studies, white papers, and executive bylines
  • Write and edit press releases, contributed articles, website copy, and social media content
  • Translate complex ideas and solutions into clear, compelling narratives tailored to B2B audiences

Project Management and Execution

  • Own and manage the communications and content calendar, ensuring deadlines are met and priorities are aligned with business goals
  • Lead projects from initial concept through review, approval, and publication
  • Coordinate with internal teams and external partners to keep work on track and on brand

Client and Executive Engagement

  • Interface directly with clients to develop case studies, announcements, presentation materials, and other communications assets
  • Collaborate closely with company executives to capture insights and perspectives for thought leadership and media opportunities
  • Prepare executives for external communications, including press interactions and public facing content

Media and Channel Management

  • Support public relations efforts, including press announcements and media outreach
  • Oversee social media messaging and content in alignment with broader communications goals
  • Monitor performance and adjust messaging based on engagement and feedback

Qualifications

  • 8 plus years of experience in communications, content marketing, public relations, or a related field
  • Proven ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while maintaining high quality standards
  • Exceptional writing, editing, and storytelling skills with a strong portfolio of published work
  • Experience working directly with senior executives and external clients
  • Strong organizational and project management capabilities
  • Comfort translating complex or technical topics into accessible, persuasive content
  • Understanding of B2B marketing; experience in healthcare and technology is a strong plus

Why This Role

This role offers the opportunity to build and scale a communications function at a pivotal stage of company growth. The Director of Communications will have meaningful influence, executive visibility, and the chance to shape how the company is perceived by the market. For the right candidate, this is a career defining opportunity to lead, create, and make a lasting impact.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary range: $163k-175k, 10-15% yearly annual bonus target

Work Location

  • Remote in the US

Benefits:

  • Health insurance
  • Dental insurance
  • Vision insurance
  • Unlimited paid time off
  • HSA company contributions
  • 401k

Hallmark Health Care Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex, age, physical, mental or sensory disability, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Hallmark reserves the right to amend the job description, duties or qualifications based on company needs.

description: Thank you for your interest in joining Solventum.

raw.title: EHR Specialist
raw.excerpt: Thank you for your interest in joining Solventum.
raw.description:
Thank you for your interest in joining Solventum. Solventum is a new healthcare company with a long legacy of solving big challenges that improve lives and help healthcare professionals perform at their best. At Solventum, people are at the heart of every innovation we pursue. Guided by empathy, insight, and clinical intelligence, we collaborate with the best minds in healthcare to address our customers’ toughest challenges. While we continue updating the Solventum Careers Page and applicant materials, some documents may still reflect legacy branding. Please note that all listed roles are Solventum positions, and our Privacy Policy: https://www.solventum.com/en-us/home/legal/website-privacy-statement/applicant-privacy/ applies to any personal information you submit. As it was with 3M, at Solventum all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Job Description:

Electronic Health Records (EHR) Specialist (Solventum)

3M Health Care is now Solventum

At Solventum, we enable better, smarter, safer healthcare to improve lives. As a new company with a long legacy of creating breakthrough solutions for our customers’ toughest challenges, we pioneer game-changing innovations at the intersection of health, material and data science that change patients' lives for the better while enabling healthcare professionals to perform at their best. Because people, and their wellbeing, are at the heart of every scientific advancement we pursue.

We partner closely with the brightest minds in healthcare to ensure that every solution we create melds the latest technology with compassion and empathy. Because at Solventum, we never stop solving for you.

The Impact You’ll Make in this Role

As an Electronic Health Records (EHR) Specialist, you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world. Here, you will make an impact by:

  • Leading the review and alignment of Business Associate Agreements (BAAs) with EHR compliance standards.
  • Implementing detailed analysis and SOP cross-referencing for EHR access and documentation.
  • Determining areas of risk, drafting recommendations, and designing approval workflows for BAA processes.
  • Supporting daily operations and compliance through audits, training, and user support for EHR platforms.
  • Willingness to be on-call to support urgent access or compliance needs.

Your Skills and Expertise

To set you up for success in this role from day one, Solventum requires (at a minimum) the following qualifications:

  • High School Diploma/GED AND two (2) years of experience in health information management, compliance and electronic health records

AND

In addition to the above requirements, the following are also required:

  • Four (4) years of experience managing EHR access, compliance audits, and regulatory protocols
  • Experience interpreting and applying HIPAA, BAA, and PHI privacy standards
  • Experience designing and updating SOPs for health information systems
  • Proficiency in electronic record systems and access management platforms

Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:

  • Master’s degree in Health Information Management, Public Health, or Healthcare Compliance from an accredited institution
  • Strong communication and cross-functional collaboration skills
  • Five (5) years of experience in a regulated healthcare environment (e.g., private, public, government, or military)
  • Strong analytical, documentation, and process design skills
  • Ability to educate and train users on compliance procedures and system best practices

Work location: Remote, United States
Travel: May include up to 10% [domestic/international]
Relocation Assistance: Not authorized

Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H1B status).

Supporting Your Well-being

Solventum offers many programs to help you live your best life – both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, Solventum regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope.

Applicable to US Applicants Only:The expected compensation range for this position is $39,360 - $54,120, which includes base pay plus variable incentive pay, if eligible. This range represents a good faith estimate for this position. The specific compensation offered to a candidate may vary based on factors including, but not limited to, the candidate’s relevant knowledge, training, skills, work location, and/or experience. In addition, this position may be eligible for a range of benefits (e.g., Medical, Dental & Vision, Health Savings Accounts, Health Care & Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts, Disability Benefits, Life Insurance, Voluntary Benefits, Paid Absences and Retirement Benefits, etc.). Additional information is available at: https://www.solventum.com/en-us/home/our-company/careers/#Total-RewardsResponsibilities of this position include that corporate policies, procedures and security standards are complied with while performing assigned duties.

Solventum is committed to maintaining the highest standards of integrity and professionalism in our recruitment process. Applicants must remain alert to fraudulent job postings and recruitment schemes that falsely claim to represent Solventum and seek to exploit job seekers.

Please note that all email communications from Solventum regarding job opportunities with the company will be from an email with a domain of @solventum.com. Be wary of unsolicited emails or messages regarding Solventum job opportunities from emails with other email domains.

Please note, Solventum does not expect candidates in this position to perform work in the unincorporated areas of Los Angeles County.Solventum is an equal opportunity employer. Solventum will not discriminate against any applicant for employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status.

Please note: your application may not be considered if you do not provide your education and work history, either by: 1) uploading a resume, or 2) entering the information into the application fields directly.

Solventum Global Terms of Use and Privacy Statement

Carefully read these Terms of Use before using this website. Your access to and use of this website and application for a job at Solventum are conditioned on your acceptance and compliance with these terms.

Please access the linked document by clicking here. Before submitting your application you will be asked to confirm your agreement with the

terms.
